loans.name: Cyrel

texts.en:
Cyrel is single but he has three children. He is forty-five years old, and resides at Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines.

Cyrel operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling seafood products including fish, crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years and each month earns PHP 3,600 from this business. 

He requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Cyrel has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Cyrel wants to save so he has a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, shampoo, bath soap and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, bath soap and beverages.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca  esta Sra. se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura, tiene más de 7 años de tener esta actividad, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de tener esta herramienta de trabajo  Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos del hogar, A pesar de no tener muchos productos inicio con lo necesario para salir adelante gracias al apoyo que Fundación León 2000 le ha brindado es que ha mejorado la calidad de su  servicio invirtiendo en el negocio y así poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes .El financiamiento es para la compra de telas, agujas, hilos, tijeras entre otros productos necesarios. Ella sueña con aumentar los ingresos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Francisca has been providing sewing services for more than seven years. She is a responsible person who enjoys having equipment for her work. Juana started earning a living in this manner out of necessity so that she could cover the household expenses. Despite not having many supplies, she started out with what she needed to get ahead.

With the support of Fundación León 2000, she has been able to improve the quality of her service, invest in her business, and satisfy the demands of her customers. This loan will be used to buy fabrics, needles, thread, scissors, and other necessary supplies. Her dream is to increase her household income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, needles, thread, scissors, and other supplies.

loans.name: Haydee Berta

texts.es: Haydee es socia del Bancomunal Alondras, tiene 41 años de edad y 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de tara, es socia de Finca Perú hace 8 años y en todo ese tiempo pudo hacer buenas amigas en su Bancomunal. Agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, ella manifiesta que Finca Perú es una institución que no solo se dedica a dar préstamo, si no que también ayuda a que las mujeres a que se superen y aprendan a ahorrar, también las capacitaciones que reciben en su Bancomunal les enseñan a tratar mejor a sus clientes, a ser puntuales  y responsables. El préstamo  que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de tara para su negocio.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of Alondras Communal Bank.  She is 41 years old and has three children.  She sells tara tree products.

She has been a member of FINCA Perú for eight years and in all this time she was able to make good friends in her communal bank.  She is grateful for the help they gave her.  She says that FINCA Perú is an institution that not only gives loans, it also helps women to improve themselves and to learn to save.  Also, the training they receive in her communal bank teaches them to treat their customers better and to be punctual and responsible.

She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying tara tree products for her business.

loans.use: to buy tara tree products for her business.

loans.name: Daglio Ulises

texts.es:
Daglio, vive acompañado por sus tres hijos y su esposa, viven en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura de esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, tiene una experiencia de 11 años en el oficio, trabaja en lo propio, su familia le ayuda a realizar todo lo que respecta al cultivo. 
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de plantas de chile, abono y foliares, pues esto le permite tener una buena cosecha, al aplicarle todo lo necesario, este préstamo le dará la ayuda necesaria a Daglio para su producción.
La aspiración de él es mejorar su trabajo y poder ofrecer a su familia una condición económica más estable.
texts.en:
Daglio lives with his wife and three children in their own house.  He works in agriculture and has managed to make his family successful.  He has eleven years of experience and works his own land.  His family helps out with all the crop-related activities.  

Daglio is seeking a loan to buy chili pepper plants and soil and leaf fertilizers, which will help him give his crops everything they need for a good harvest.  

Daglio aspires to improve his business so he can offer his family more stable economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy chili pepper plants and soil and leaf fertilizers.

loans.name: Harapan Jaya 12 Group

texts.en:
Inah is the leader of Harapan Jaya 12 group. She plans to use her part of loan to repair her house so that it will have a better kiosk for her merchandise.

She really hopes that she can contribute more to her family, and not just by her income. Also by having a better place to live. She hopes in the future she can still have enough money to pay for her children's school fee.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the house to have a better kiosk.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is widowed and has one child. She is 57 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Marilyn sells longganisa sausage to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her sausage business.

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Marilyn hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her sausage business.

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita is 45 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has seven children.

Marcelita works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 18 years. She has requested loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fishing net.

Marcelita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Marcelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros is 43 years old and a diligent father of five children, living with his family in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. Recently, two of his children were married and and now live separately in other parts of the province.

Ros maintains his children by providing construction services. As a team leader in his group, he typically earns around USD 5.00 per day. Ros is sociable and has a good relationship with the people in his neighborhood, and that is why they prefer to use his services when they need house repairs.

With the loan amount of USD 1,500, Ros would like to renovate and expand his own house. He will purchase bricks, cements, zinc and other construction supplies needed for the project. He hopes that our lenders won’t reject his first loan request, and he is thankful for your help.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cements, zinc and other construction supplies to renovate his house.

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, a 26-year-old married mother of a young child, resides in Prey Chor district where she generates her main source of income by growing rice for both daily sustenance as well as for sale on farmland she inherited. Her husband works in the construction field to provide additional income for the family.

Phen is requesting a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for both home and business use, allowing her family to travel about freely and reduce unnecessary transportation expenses. She hopes for an improved standard of living through hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for both home and business use.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 27 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child.
 
Emily has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase feed for her hog-fattening business.
 
Emily has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Emily hopes to purchase additional piglets.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is from Inroad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 33 years old, married and has five children. 

To make a living, Patrocinia owns and operates a general store. Patrocinia is been two years in this business and earns 3,000 PHP a month.
 
In 2007, Patrocinia joined Kiva partner GDMPC. Patrocinia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Onn

texts.en:
Onn is 31 years old and a married woman who is responsible for two school-age children. She lives with her family in a village of Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. She is a good mother and housewife who pays full attention to her family, cares for her children, serves food, and prepares everything in a well-arranged way. 

She says that to provide a healthy and comfortable living to her family is the main obligation for her. However, Onn also wants to help her husband earn income for the family. And recently, Onn has been involved in a fruit-selling business. She retails mangoes that she buys in bulk from a plantation in her commune. From this business, Onn is able to make an income of USD 5 per day. 

To further develop her business, Onn would like to take out a loan of USD 1,300 to purchase mangoes in bulk for future sale. She believes that this loan will enable her to work out her plans, and she hopes that she will becomes successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes in bulk for future sale.

loans.name: Jade Center Group

texts.en:
Luzvisminda is 55 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Pagadian City. She is married and has one adopted child.

She has a lot of businesses including her Internet cafe and her ice cream retailing business, and she earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to complete her house.

Luzvisminda has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, she hopes to be a very successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to complete her house.

loans.name: Josefina Charito

texts.en:
Josefina Charito is married and has four children. Josefina Charito is 46 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Josefina Charito sells Avon and Natasha products to earn a living and had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP for additional capital to buy products.

Josefina Charito has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Josefina Charito hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy avon and natasha products to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has three children. Evelyn is 60 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Evelyn has a multi-cab-for-hire business. (A multi-cab is a small passenger and/or cargo van.) She has had this business for 10 years and each month she earns approximately PHP 7,000.

She has requested a loan of 20,900 PHP to purchase multi-cab tires for her business.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to purchase another multi-cab unit. Evelyn is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase multi-cab tires for her business.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with six children, three of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Said has been selling petroleum for the past two years at the market where motorcycle operators are his main customers. Before this business, Said depended on subsistence farming for his livelihood. He faces the major challenge of petroleum price fluctuations.

Said decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With a loan of Kshs 50,000, he wants to purchase petroleum for resale.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of petroleum for resale.

loans.name: Fredis Franco

texts.es:
Fredis, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus dos hijos, en su casa todos trabajan, él comenzó con su venta de ropa desde hace tres años, lo aprendió como empleado en una comercial, trabaja en lo propio, no tiene un horario establecido.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa tanto para niños como para adultos, esta compra le permitirá crecer y tener mercadería necesaria para trabajar y continuar ofreciendo a sus clientes.
Su objetivo es crecer, que su negocio sea rentable y poder generar a su familia lo necesario para la sobrevivencia.
texts.en:
Fredis, a clothes trader, lives with his family, his wife, and his two children.  They all work at home.  He began selling clothing three years ago; he learned the business while employed in a commercial store. He works in his own now, and does not have a set schedule.

He asks for the loan to buy clothing for both children and adults.  This purchase will allow him to grow and to have the merchandise necessary to work and to continue offering to his customers.  His goal is to grow so that his business will be profitable and be able to generate what his family needs to survive.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Mile

texts.en:
Mile lives in the north part of the country and has five grown-up children from 36 to 21 years of age. It's her third time applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania.

For the past 12 years she has been operating a stand-alone banquet hall which has been the only hall in the region. Families here are multi-children families, therefore the use of a banquet hall has become essential to the locals and of course the demand for it is high.  Due to weather conditions in the winter, though, the lack of power has caused inconvenience to both Mile and locals. 

In an effort to serve her clients and all others in the region better and all the time, she is considering buying an electric generator. She has proved her responsibility in the past; has paid her previous loans in full and on time.

loans.use: To buy an electric generator for her banquet hall

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Reyna  inicio este negocio hace dos años por la necesidad de tener una herramienta de trabajo propia ya que tiene dos hijos y ella es jefa de familia, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, ella está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en la compra de inventario para su negocio que consisten en comprar licor nacional y extrajero
texts.en: Reyna began this business two years ago out of the necessity of having her own source of work, since she has two children and is the head of her family.  The business is located in her home.  She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of inventory for her business, which consists of buying national and foreign liquor.

loans.use: to make purchases, giving her capital to work with.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark lives in North Albania and has four children. Three of his children are still attending elementary and secondary school. He and his wife have been in the farming business for the past seven years. They own land where they grow corn, wheat, veggies and field crops. In addition, Mark now owns three "dynyms" of vineyard. He is satisfied with the progress of his business. So far, they have been using primitive tools for field plowing and this has required hard labour. 

The first loan from VF Albania which has been paid off now, helped Mark buy the land. Now he is considering buying a tractor, so that he can plow the land faster and without putting in so much hard labour. Mark’s plans also include using the tractor to plow other farmers’ fields because no one in his village owns a tractor.

loans.use: To buy a tractor

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, solamente él trabaja, su esposa es ama de casa, él se dedica a la reparación de vehículos, este oficio lo aprendió donde trabajo anteriormente, no tiene empleados, su horario no es establecido, pues depende de la demanda de los clientes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para vehículos, como baterías, grasa, aceite, llaves, empaques, llantas, esta compra le ayudara para crecer con el negocio, teniendo todo lo necesario  para atender a los clientes.
Su aspiración es crece en el negocio, tener más clientela, pues de ellos dependen sus ingresos, además de contribuir al desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and their four children.  Only he works (outside the home); his wife is a housewife.  He works repairing vehicles and he learned this trade where he worked previously.  He doesn't have employees and his schedule isn't fixed as it depends on the demand of his customers.  Currently he is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts for vehicles such as batteries, grease, oil, keys, gear gaskets, tires.  This purchase will help him to grow his business, having all that is necessary to attend to his customers.

His aspiration is to grow his business, having more customers, since his income depends on them, as well as to contribute to the development of his family.

loans.use: to purchase batteries, grease, oil, keys, gear gaskets, and tires.

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
Kodjovi est un homme âgé  de 27 ans. Il est marié à une couturière et a 01 enfant.
Kodjovi travaille comme frigoriste  depuis 2005. Il exerce seul son activité dans une boutique et vend en même temps des congélateurs achetés au Port de Lomé.
Kodjovi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des congélateurs. Il veut épargner.
Dans les prochaines années, Kodjovi voudrait mobiliser les fonds pour ajouter d’autres matériels complémentaires Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodjovi is a 27-year-old man. He is married to a dressmaker and has one child. He has worked with fridges since 2005. He works alone in a store, and also sells freezers which he buys at Lomé Port.

Kodjovi has requested this first loan from WAGES to purchase freezers. He wants to save money. Over the coming years he would like to gather enough money to add additional materials. With his profits he plans to ensure that his family gets ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy freezers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a larger inventory of food items

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en: Alejandrina is a 54-year old married woman with a child living in Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay. Her husband is a farmer. In order to add income for the family, she entered into a retail business two years ago. She usually gets 5,000 PHP each month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Alejandrina is able to buy more fruits to sell because of the 12,000 PHP loan rendered to her. She joined GDMPC in 2009. She hopes for a much greater revenue for a business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to sell

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Leonarda Yamilet

texts.es: Leonardo  Yamilet  tiene 44 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que se siente muy feliz con los créditos que han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Inicio este negocio para generar ingresos a su familia ya que tiene hijos menores de edad a su cargo, ella sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general, cremas, tratamientos, toallas y sabanas entre otros productos.
texts.en: Leonarda Yamilet, 44, works selling general merchandise.  She has worked with the Foundation for a while, and is very happy with the loans that she has received and which have been a great help to her business.  She began this business in order to generate income for her family because she has young children in her care.  She goes out every day to sell her products.  The loan is for the purchase of footwear, cosmetics, clothing in general, creams, treatments, towels and sheets, among other products.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cosmetics, clothing in general, creams, treatments, towels and sheets, among other products.

loans.name: Bouraima

texts.fr:
Bouraîma est  un homme âgé  de 29 ans. Il est célibataire et revendeur de portables et accessoires dans une boutique depuis 2003.
Bouraîma est à son premier crédit de WAGES et ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des appareils portables, des crédits de communication, des serrures et divers. Il veut agrandir la boutique et se lancer dans la vie maritale.
texts.en:
Bouraîma is a 29-year-old man. He is single and has worked reselling cellphones and accessories in a store since 2003.

This is Bouraîma’s first loan from WAGES, and it will allow him to buy cellphones, call credit, locks and miscellaneous articles. He wants to expand his store and get married.

loans.use: To buy cellphones and cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Dagbegnikin Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DAGBEGNIKIN est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement du nom de Natacha est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Natacha est âgée de 25 ans et vit au Bénin. Natacha est mariée à un certain Raymond. Le couple a deux enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Natacha n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Natacha vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différents besoins de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Natacha vend du sucre, de l'arachide et des vivres (maïs, etc.) dans un marché du Benin depuis sept ans. Natacha s’approvisionne au Benin. Grâce au revenu que lui génèrent ces activités, Natacha contribue aux différents besoins de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Natacha sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DAGBEGNIKIN.
texts.en:
The Dagbegnikin group has 12 members, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Natacha, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. 

Natacha is 25 years of age and lives in Benin. She is married to Raymond, and the couple has two children at school under their care. Natacha herself did not go to school. She lives with her children and husband, and together with her husband she makes sure the family’s various needs are met. To contribute to meeting these needs, Natacha sells sugar, peanuts and foodstuffs (corn, etc.) in a market in Benin, and has done so for seven years. The revenue generated from this business allows her to help with her family’s various needs. 

To meet the requests of her every-growing customer base, Natacha has asked for a third loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the Dagbegnikin group.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn, peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Abraham Gaudencio

texts.es:
El señor Abraham vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, la casa en la que actualmente reside es de su suegra ubicada en la colonia Buenavista, el cuenta con un empleo en una línea de transportes como operador con una antigüedad de 2 años, su esposa se dedica a sus hijos para brindarles tiempo suficiente, cuando ellos estan en la escuela atiende su negocio de venta de ropa usada con el proposito de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos. A pesar del esfuerzo por parte de los dos, no alcanzan financiar el sueño de tener una mejor casa.
Como objetivo se propuso darle un mayor bienestar a su familia con la mejora de la casa, cambiando el piso, enjarrando las paredes y pintar la casa.
texts.en:
Abraham lives with his wife and three children in his mother-in-law’s home in the community of Buenavista. He has worked for the past two years as an operator for a transportation company, and his wife takes care of their children and tries to give them sufficient time and energy. When they are in school, she works at her used clothing business in order to help with the household expenses. Even with both of their hard work, they are unable to come up with the funds necessary to buy their own house.  

With the goal of giving their family a better quality of life in their current home, they plan to use the support from this loan to put in a new floor, plaster the walls and paint the house.

loans.use: to finish the exterior of his home (floor, plaster and paint).

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es originario del municipio de El Sauce, como padre responsable de su hogar trabaja arduamente en una Institución del Estado desde hace muchos años, actividad que le ha permitido preparar a sus hijas y construir su propia vivienda la que han ido mejorando con estos pequeños créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel.
Por ese motivo le agradece por este apoyo incondicional a las personas asalariadas ya que sin ello no pudieran llevar a cabo sus sueños porque el salario solo abarca para los gastos del hogar.
En este momento quiere mejorar la cocina de su vivienda por eso está solicitando su quinto crédito para comprar cemento, alambre, arena, ladrillo, hierro y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en: Wilfredo is from the town of El Sauce.  As a father responsible for his home, he has worked arduously in a state institution for many years.  This activity has allowed him to raise his daughters and to build his own home, which he has been improving with the small loans that CEPRODEL has granted him.  For this reason he is grateful for this unconditional help to wage-earning people because without it they would not be able to carry out their dreams since the wages only cover household expenses.  At the moment, he wants to improve the kitchen in his house so he is asking for his fifth loan to buy cement, wire, sand, brick, iron, and to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy cement, wire, sand, brick, iron and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Hildah

texts.en:
Hildah is a farmer in Kisii area, South Rift Kenya. She is married and has five children, who are all in school. She has been in the farming business for four years and sells her maize, beans, and bananas to the local market.

Hildah has requested a loan of 26,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will use the income to provide basic needs for her family and educate her children as she focuses on buying two more dairy cows in the near future.

Hildah says animal diseases and poor market prices remain the major challenges in her farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline is married, 43 years of age, and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental together with her three kids. Jacquiline is operating a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and she earns 6,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 15,300 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC last year. 

In the future, Jacquiline will use her income to support her kids in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Jacquiline wishes that their business will be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is married and has six children and he is 45 years old. He resides at Sigatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Cesar is operating a venture raising crops, planting & harvesting coconuts for sale in the local community to earn a living and he has been 5 years in this business. Each month, he earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2007, Cesar joined GDMPC. In the future, Cesar wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida de 59 años de edad se dedica al oficio de confecciones, actividad que desarrolló una vez terminó su educación primaria y a sus 17, años inició su vida laboral como operaria de una empresa importante de confecciones. Posteriormente se independizó en su propio negocio y se hace cargo de su padre y una vez nacieron sus hijos se dedicó a la microempresa con mayor énfasis. Sus principales líneas de confección son la ropa interior  y exterior para damas, , su clientela está ubicada en el sector donde habita, donde es muy reconocida por su buen diseño. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y también ofrece el servicio sobre medidas, trabajando en este último de contado. En la actualidad su mayor desafío para lograr un crecimiento armónico es que no cuenta con capital de trabajo para extenderse, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, materias primas en mayor volumen como telas e hilos y también insumos para dar un buen acabado a las prendas que confecciona. Su inversión planea ser exitosa por la calidad de sus confecciones y porque lo hace sobre pedidos de sus clientes en la época que mas lo necesitan: El día de las madres.
texts.en:
Zaida is 59 years old, and makes a living as a seamstress. She began working in the trade as soon as she completed her primary education at age 17, and her first job was operating machines in a sewing workshop. After a few years, she decided to create her own business and become more independent, since she had to take care of her father. When her children were born, she worked even harder to make her business successful so that she could provide for them. She primarily sews clothing and undergarments for women, though she does make other products. She serves a customer base located mostly in her region, and she is well known for her designing talent. 

She conducts her sales on credit, and also offers services to clients where they can pay cash up front. The biggest challenge she currently faces to steady business growth is the fact that she lacks the necessary capital to invest in infrastructural improvements. With her challenges and goals in mind, she is requesting this loan, which will be her first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and Kiva. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase materials in bulk, such as fabric, thread and other input items. She believes that this will be a successful and worthwhile investment, since she already creates high quality products, and her customers are happy with her quality of work. She hopes to make these investments in her business just before its most profitable season: Mother’s Day.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and other materials in bulk for her sewing business.

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Mrs. Solongo, 42, runs a collection point for recycled materials in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business alone for six years. She is widowed and she lives with her three children in her old house which is located in the 'ger' district of the city. Her business earnings do not usually suffice to meet her family necessities, because all of her children attend secondary school. 

This summer she is planning to do some renovation on her old house that is in bad condition. One of them will be having a low-pressure furnace installed in it. In wintertime, her house becomes very cold to live in with a coal furnace. She also thinks it will be very useful and important to cut down on smoky coal usage. 

Every year she pays a great deal to buy the coal for heating her home. It also makes the air pollution worse all around the city. Air pollution and air quality is becoming one of biggest issues in Mongolian households and big cities. The loan she is taking out will be used to cover the cost of a low-pressure furnace for her old house.

loans.use: To cover the cost of a low-pressure furnace for her old house.

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
Marcella is a mother of four adult children. She has been in farming for six years and sells her produce to the local market in her rural area in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya.

Marcella has requested a loan of 20,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the acquisition of the dairy cow will provide her with milk for consumption and extra income to meet other basic needs. She plans to buy two more dairy cows once the business stabilizes.

She is however worried about the high cost of capital from financial institutions but appreciates Juhudi.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  green bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in cooking local delicacies

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
This is Sharon, 48, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is a widow and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Sharon operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, she also sells rice in her store. Sharon earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Sharon hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to have her own house and lot in a nice location. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sodnombaldan

texts.en:
Mr. Sodnombaldan, 22, is a repairman in the railway company. He has been doing his job for 5 years. He is unmarried and lives with his family in the house of his parents which is in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

His family plants vegetables such as potatoes, carrots and cabbages on their plot of land/backyard of house. This summer, they want to plant more kinds of vegetables for family use and sales to the markets. It needs some kind of fertilizers and seeds at first. He thinks that he could have a bigger harvest/bumper crop next year. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to cover the cost of fertilizers and seeds for more vegetables.

loans.use: To cover the cost of fertilizers and seeds for more vegetables.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: La  Sra. Maritza  se dedica a la venta de comida. Esta actividad la inicio por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo para poder sufragar gastos económicos  pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma honrada El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, utensilios de cocina, leña, carnes, condimentos  entre otras cosas, gracias al apoyo que fundación león 2000 le brinda ha podido cumplir sus sueños de mantener el negocio de forma rentable ya que sus ventas han incrementado por su buen servicio.
texts.en: Maritza works selling food.  She started this business out of the necessity of having a means of work to be able to defray her economic expenses.  She has always shown herself to be a responsible person, since she has always liked to work and earn her living in an honorable way.  The motive of the loan is to purchase staple goods, vegetables, kitchen utensils, firewood, meat, condiments, among other things.  Thank to the support that the Fundación León 2000 has given her, she has been able to achieve her dream of maintaining her business in a profitable manner since her sales have grown due to her good service.

loans.use: to purchase staple foods, vegetables, kitchen utensils, firewood, meat, and condiments, among other things.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina tiene 27 años, viven en su casa propia junto a sus dos pequeños hijos; Darío de 7 y Aldair de 3 años. Para ella, sus hijos son los más importantes en su vida.

La actividad que realiza es a la venta de refrescos en un puesto que implementó en su vivienda. Lleva 5 años con esta actividad y considera que los días más difíciles son las temporadas de lluvia, ya que la gente no pasa mucho por su puesto. Esta labor es rentable porque siempre tiene un ingreso que le ayuda con sus necesidades y la educación de sus hijos.
Con el tiempo desea abrir una tienda de abarrotes para estar aun más estable económicamente, pero su prioridad ahora es comprar una congeladora para poder enfriar los refrescos de manera más rápida.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para poder seguir con su trabajo. En su banco comunal es una socia activa y agradecida por formar parte de ellos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará la congeladora que tanto necesita.
texts.en:
Albina is 27 years old. She lives in her own house with her two small children, Darío (7 years old) and Aldair (3 years old). For her, her children are the most important thing in her life. 

The activity which she carries out is the sale of soft drinks from a stall which she set up in her home. She has been working in this way for 5 years and she says that the most difficult days are during periods of rain when people don't often come to her stall. This work is worthwhile as she always has an income which helps her with her needs and her children's education. In time, she would like to open a grocery store in order to have even more economic stability, but her priority now is to buy a freezer so that she can cool drinks as quickly as possible. 

This is her first loan with MFP, and she is happy to receive financial assistance so that she can continue her work. She is an active member of her community bank and is grateful to be part of this scheme. With the 1,000 nuevos soles which she is now requesting she will buy the freezer she so badly needs.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a mother of four children all of schooling age. She has been in farming for two years with her farm currently producing beans, milk and bananas for the local market. She lives with her family in their rural home in Kisii area, South Rift, Kenya.

Norah has requested a loan of 20,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She plans to grow her farming business to three dairy cows and improve the quality of her breeds as the business grows. She says farming has been the source of her income through which she meets family basic needs.

She laments animal diseases and natural calamities like hailstorms.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Surenbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Surenbaatar, 51, has worked as an engineer in a private company for 16 years. He lives with his family in his old and bad house in Kherlen, an eastern city in Mongolia. His house, which was built earlier of 1980’s, has gotten old and uncomfortable to live there. So he decided to make some renovations such as the wall insulation and purchasing a low-pressure furnace to get his house warmer. Also, he believes that it will cut the usage of the harmful and smokey coal usage throughout the whole year. In last several years, air pollution and air quality is one of the biggest issues in most Mongolian households and big cities. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of low-pressure furnace and purchasing the building materials to make insulation to his old house walls.

loans.use: To cover the cost of low-pressure furnace and purchasing the building materials to make insulation to his old house walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks

loans.name: Sephrose

texts.en: Sephrose is a 40-year-old married woman with 4 children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for 15 years and is so proud of her profession. Her personal goal is educating children up to the university level. Sephrose wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en: Jeneth is a married woman with 4 children, ages between 2 and 16 years. She raises pigs to earn a living. She also sells rice cakes and other delicacies. Jeneth works hard to improve her earnings and support her family. She requested a loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. Jeneth hopes to have sufficient income to sustain her family and her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a thirty-nine-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a nursing assistant for eleven years and has worked in a number of hospitals. He wishes to educate himself and his children to attain high qualifications so as to have well-paying jobs and a better standard of living.

Jonathan intends to use the money to pay school fees for his children as the new term has just begun.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is married with four children. Generosa is 43 years old and lives at Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Generosa buys and sells fish to earn a living and she's been 14 years in this business. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Generosa been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Generosa wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Asanairi

texts.en: Asanairi is a forty-three-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been teaching for two years and with his salary he has been able to invest in the coffee business. His personal goals are educating his children, self-education and boosting his coffee business. Asanairi  wants money to buy coffee for resale.

loans.use: to buy coffee for resale.

loans.name: Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Son 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, las que se unieron y decidieron formar el grupo llamado “Unidas por el progreso” donde todas ellas trabajan y se ayudan mutuamente.,  para que de esa forma puedan salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos y familiares.
Irma es una de las integrantes del grupo, y nos comenta que por medio de su trabajo y empeño ha podido salir adelante y también ha podido ayudar a su familia. Ella constantemente está buscando opciones de cómo seguir creciendo y mejorando su negocio. Tiene una despensa, con la cual ayuda a su familia y les da lo que ellos necesitan.
Ella se ha acercado para solicitar un crédito, el cual desea invertir en la compra de lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados y demás insumos para poder abastecer su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eleven women in the city of Santaní got together and decided to form the group named “Unidas por el progreso,” where they all work and help each other in order to get ahead and help their children and relatives.
Irma is one of the members of this group, and says that through her work and effort she has been able to get ahead and has also been able to help her family. She is constantly looking for options and ways to keep growing and improving her business. She has a small grocery store, which allows her to help her family and give them what they need.
She came to request a loan, which she wishes to invest in purchasing dairy products, bread products, canned goods, and other items, in order to stock her business so that she can continue offering her customers variety.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store, such as dairy products, bread products, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La Señora Mirtha es de Ciudad del Este, ella tiene una pequeña peluquería, la cual quiere remodelar para poder brindar más comodidad a sus clientes, y de esa forma también tener un poco mas de ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia, es por ello que solicita la ayuda de fundación y a Kiva, ya que desea poder seguir creciendo día a día.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo con un gran espíritu de superación, es muy capacitada y sabe mucho de lo que hace. Su meta es poder tener un gran salón de belleza y poder ser reconocida por todos lados.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Mirtha is from Ciudad del Este (City of the East), and operates a small hair salon. She wants to remodel her salon in order to offer her clients a more comfortable environment, and generate more income to help support her family. She is requesting this loan in order to help grow her business.

She is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. She has much experience in her field, and knows what she is doing. Her goal is to one day have a large beauty salon, and to be widely known for her talent. She is grateful for this opportunity, and believes that the support will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 59 years old and a businessman. He is married to Grace who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children who are adults. Jeremiah has been in the quarry mining business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of KES. 15,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Jeremiah will use the loan to buy mining equipment and employ labor. 


With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a dairy cow. His hopes and dreams are to buy another mining site.

loans.use: to buy mining equipment and employ labor

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has one child. Nenita owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products  such as shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc. and snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

 In 2007, Nenita joined GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Luzvimenda

texts.en:
Luzvimenda is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Luzvimenda has a shop that sells snacks and viands. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients in making viands and snacks like fresh meat, vegetables, dressed chicken with flour and seasonings.
Luzvimenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Luzvimenda hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viands

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is married and has 3 children. He is 36 years old, residing at Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental: Philippines.

Rodulfo operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including crab and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been 13 years in this business. Each month, he earns 35,000 PHP doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Rodulfo has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rodulfo wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, bath soap, and beverages

loans.name: Simplisio

texts.en: Simplisio is a thirty one year old married man with four children living in Kasese,Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for ten years. His personal goal is to build a permanent home for residence since he spends alot on rent. Simplisio wants a loan to build a permanent house for residence.

loans.use: to build a permanent house for residence.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Aside from farming, Violeta also sells rice cakes and banana kyu (deep fried banana coated in carmelized brown sugar) to her community. She works hard to meet the needs of her family.

Violeta is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to have sufficient capital to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 59 years old, married and a father of six children. For the last ten years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce from his farm. He earns a monthly profit of KES 9,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his first loan, for KES 28,000, to buy harvesting baskets for his farm produce for easy transfer to the market where he will sell to his customers. 

Francis will use the profits made possible by this loan to continue looking after his family as well as try to expand his farm. His goal for the future is to continue farming with an aim of venturing into mixed farming so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy harvesting baskets for his farm produce

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a mother of five children between the ages of 9 and 22. She has been operating a clothes-selling business for the past 10 years. She sells clothes to local residents and passersby in a shop located at the market. 

High transportation costs and theft of goods are her major challenges. She dreams of opening a shop in the future. 

Rosemary lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan of KES 50,000, she will be able to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en: Maurecia of Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, supports the needs of her five children through food vending. She's been vending for 14 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She’s a 49-year-old mother who tries her best to earn on her own. For the time being, in 2011 she joined GDMPC and applied for a loan of 7,600 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Thanks to GDMPC microfinance for providing for such needs. Maurecia desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is a married woman with five children aged between 11 and 23 years. Her husband works as a driver. To earn a living, Candelaria sells vegetables and dried fish to her community. She also sells bananas. Candelaria works hard to support her family. It is also her priority to send her children to school. She requested a loan to buy more dried fish and vegetables to sell. Candelaria hopes for this loan to help increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is a 62-year-old married man with 12 children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years and he acquired the capital from selling coffee. His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation, inadequate capital to purchase stock, and high transportation costs. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house for residence. His business goal is buying land so as to farm on a commercial basis. Ernest needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, and smearing oil (body oil/lotion) to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, and smearing oil to sell.

loans.name: Noubignon Group

texts.fr: NOUBIGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même maison. La représentante du groupe, Caridas Roseline Nadia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 28 ans. Caridas Roseline Nadia est mariée à un certain Sylvain. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Caridas Roseline Nadia vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Caridas Roseline Nadia a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Caridas Roseline Nadia vend depuis quatre ans, des produits divers dans un marché du Bénin. Caridas Roseline Nadia s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Caridas Roseline Nadia sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NOUBIGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
NOUBIGNON is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same house. The group's representative, Caridas Roseline Nadia (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 28 years old and married to a man named Sylvain. They have three children, all in school and in their care. Roseline lives together with her husband and children. The various household expenses are covered by the couple. 

Roseline halted her studies in secondary school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling various items at a market in Benin for four years. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and aiming to expand her business, Roseline, along with the other members of the group NOUBIGNON, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve them to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The loans received previously have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Shielle

texts.en:
Shielle is 31 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of two children. 

Shielle operates a snack food business to earn a living. She has been in this type of business for eight years. She earns 6,000 PHP each month from these activities. 

Shielle has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase raw ingredients needed to make snack foods for sale. She has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Shielle hopes to expand her business and have a stall in the city for food vending.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make snack foods for sale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 38 years old. He is married and has two children. He operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been in this business for the past 11 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This is Charles' first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced by a field officer. He plans to use the total loan amount to purchase spare parts and service his motorcycle.

Charles hopes to purchase a pick-up truck in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is from Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 41 years old. Mary Jane is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Mary Jane manages a business planting and harvesting fish and shrimp for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 16 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2011, Mary Jane joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,200 PHP, which will be used to buy young fish to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy young fish to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee for resale

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She also sells fruits and vegetables in her community. Celestina needs additional capital for her farm. She plans to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. Celestina hopes for her harvest to increase. She also hopes for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Medesse Group

texts.fr: MEDESSE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Clotilde Seflimè (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans. Clotilde Seflimè est mariée à un certain Mesmin. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clotilde Seflimè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Clotilde Seflimè a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Clotilde Seflimè vend depuis six ans, des produits vivriers (riz, maïs, et autres) à son domicile. Clotilde Seflimè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Cécile sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MEDESSE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MEDESSE is a group of three persons whose members are friends. The group's representative, Clotilde Seflimè (whose hand is raise in the photo), is 33 years old and married to a man named Mesmin. They have five children, all in school and in their care. Clotilde lives together with her husband and children. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple.

Clotilde halted her studies in primary school. To cope with her different expenses, she has been selling staple foods (rice, corn, and more) out of her home for six years. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and aiming to expand her business, Clotilde along with the other members of the group MEDESSE are requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve them to respond better to the demands of their customers and to make more profit. The loans received previously have indeed been paid back.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ernel

texts.en:
Ernel is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children. 

Ernel provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools, like a T-wrench and screwdriver, and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

Ernel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Ernel hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Ney

texts.en:
Ney, 42 years old, is a single mother who is responsible for three children. Two of her children are employed and help their mother financially, while her youngest child is attending school. Ney lives with her children in Ornlong Veng district, where she has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to rice farming. She owns a few hectares of farmland, on which she plants rice crops annually to provide enough sustenance for the family.

Due to the coming rainy season, Ney would like to request a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase herbicides and lubricant oil, and to pay fees for plowing. She is very happy with the great help of the loan. It will enable her to develop her business and improve her standard of living. She hopes that she will be able to have a fruitful harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and lubricant oil, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Janice

texts.en: Janice is married with 2 children. Janice is 28 years old and resides at Riverside, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Janice owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 9,400 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Janice joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Janice wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
For 13 years in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Angie, a 30-year-old married mother of 3 children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,500 PHP per month for these activities.
In 2009, Angie joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 4,700 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a 45-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 17 and 25 years. Three of her children are in school. She is married to Mwachipuli. Umazi has been operating a food stall for the last 10 years, selling her goods from home. Her side job is farming. Her dream is to expand the business and open a hotel. Umazi joined Yehu to get access to loans. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. 
With the loan of KES 50,000, she plans to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy saucepans, basins, cups, and plates to sell.

loans.name: Henny

texts.en: Henny of Barangay II, Tangub City has managed a business buying and selling fish for more than 10 years and earns 15,000 PHP per month. Henny is 38 years old now, yet continues to hang on with her fish vending livelihood to give an adequate life to her 2 children. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In order to enhance her fish upon selling, she is borrowing the amount of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional fish to sell. Henny hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar lives in Kvareli District, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Sophio and 3-year-old daughter. Sophio is a housewife. Nugzar is at the moment unemployed. He works in seasonal agricultural work in the neighboring farms, when he has orders and is paid for his work. The family lives in poverty. According to Credo estimations they belong to the vulnerable poor category. Their average monthly income is 100 Laris.

Nugzar requested credit to restart his business, which was stopped 3 months ago. He used to trade in fruits and vegetables. He was selling green grocery products in nearby towns, but stopped the business, as his old car was out of order. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Nugzar will purchase a better car and will restart the business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for trade business (Fruits & Vegetables)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 30 años, es madre de tres hijos, con los que vive en la casa que con gran esfuerzo logró obtener.
Todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y enviarlos a la escuela. Después se dirige a sus campos de cultivo donde tiene cacao. Esta labor la lleva realizando hace más de 10 años y en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de peones quienes le ayudan a cargar su cosecha. Posteriormente seca los granos para luego llevarlos a los centros de acopio. Para el futuro, desea incrementar sus sembríos, pero por el momento desea en terminar la fachada de su vivienda para vivir en hogar más tranquilo y acogedor.

Este será crédito número 6 con MFP, donde se siente contenta por la oportunidad que le brindan. Asimismo, agradece a los compañeros de su banco comunal por permitirle ser parte de ello y se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago.
Con el préstamo que ahora solicita comprará cemento y pintura para terminar la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carmen is 30 years old and a mother of three. She lives with her children in their home, which she was able to obtain with great effort.

She gets up very early every morning to prepare her childrens' breakfast and send them to school. Then she heads over to her crop fields, where she grows cocoa beans. She has been doing this for over 10 years, and during the harvest season she gets help from her laborers, who assist her in loading the harvest. Subsequently she dries the beans so that she can later take them to the distribution warehouses. In the future, she would like to cultivate more land, but for now she wishes to finish the exterior walls of her house so that she can live in a quieter and cozier home.

This will be her 6th loan with MFP, where she feels happy with the opportunity she is offered. She is also grateful to her partners in the communal bank for allowing her to become a part of this and she is committed to paying her installments timely.

She will use the loan she is now requesting to purchase cement and paint to finish the exterior walls of her home.

loans.use: to purchase cement and paint.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 31 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nemesio, de 39 años, y sus tres hijos a quienes desean brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella se dedica al cultivo de caco y café, productos que la mayoría de los agricultores siembran en su zona por las buenas ganancias que obtienen. Carmen lleva 15 años realizando esta labor con la ayuda de su esposo, quien se encarga de ver que las malezas no perjudiquen sus plantas. En tiempos de cosecha contrata a jornaleros, quienes le apoyan con la cogida de los frutos de cacao y café. Estos productos los lleva a vender en los centros de acopio de su localidad, quienes le dan buenas ganancias por cada kilo. Su prioridad ahora es comprar injertos de cacao y café para incrementar su producción.

Este será su crédito número 8 con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Los 3,500 nuevos soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de plantas de cacao y café. Con el resto comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus plantas.
texts.en:
Carmen is 31 and lives in her own home with her husband, Nemesio, and her three children.  She and her husband would like to provide their children a better life.

She cultivates cocoa and coffee, crops that most of the farmers in her area grow for the good profits they yield.  Carmen has worked 15 years in this line of work with the help of her spouse, who is responsible for making sure that weeds do not harm the plants.  At harvest time hired laborers are used to pick the cocoa and coffee beans.  They sell the harvests to local collection centers, which give good profits per kilo. Her priority now is to buy grafted cacoa and coffee to increase production.

This will be Carmen's eighth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma and she promises to be punctual with her payments.  Also, she would like to thank the members of the communal bank for being supportive and responsible.

The $1,325 (3500 PEN) that is being requested will be invested in the purchase of cocoa and coffee plants.  With the rest, she will buy sacks of manure to fertilize the plants.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and coffee plants.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es: La Sra. Serafina  tiene 57 años y es casada con un hijo que tiene la edad de veinte años, la Sra. Serafina se dedica a la confección de enagua para las mujeres de pollera para las cholitas, su taller y domicilio se encuentra en la zona de Huayra Kassa, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Serafina utilizara el dinero en la compra de material de construcción ya que está haciendo construir un cuarto en su casa su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar calidad de vida de su familia y brindarles comodidad, la Sra. Serafina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y seguirá utilizando  los beneficios en construir su vivienda para su hijo, y con el tiempo desea tener un taller más grande y contratar operarios y entregar su mercadería a los distintos mercados de la Ciudad de Cochabamba, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le  brindan.
texts.en: Serafina, 57, is married and has a 20 year-old son.  She has a business making the petticoats that the "cholitas," (indigenous women who wear the traditional costume), wear with traditional Bolivian skirts. Her workshop and home are located in the Huayra Kassa neighborhood.  This will be her second loan with the institution.  Serafina will use the money to buy construction materials, because she is adding a room to her house.  She is requesting this loan so that she can improve her family's quality of life and provide them with greater comfort.  Serafina faces challenges in her business, such as the competition.  She will continue to use the profits from this business to build a house for her son.  Over time, she wants to have a bigger workshop, to hire employees, and to deliver her merchandise to the various markets in the City of Cochabamba.  She feels happy and grateful that you are providing her with this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room

loans.name: Mivado Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIVADO est composé de trois personnes qui sont issues de la même famille. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Agnès est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Agnès est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Agnès n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Agnès est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Bonaventure. Le couple a trois, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agnès vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de faire face à ses multiples charges, Agnès vend depuis quatre ans, du maïs et de l'akassa (aliment local préparé à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile. Agnès s’approvisionne dans le nord du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Agnès sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MIVADO, un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group MIVADO comprises three persons who are from the same family. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for boosting their business. The group's representative, Agnès, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 42 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a driver named Bonaventure. They have three children, all in school and in their care. Agnès lives together with her husband and children. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple.

To cope with her multiple expenses, Agnès has been selling corn and akassa (a local food made from corn starch) out of her home for four years. She gets her supplies from northern Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Agnès along with the other members of the group MIVADO are requesting another loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Amada

texts.en: Amada is married with 6 children. Amada is 54 years old and resides at Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Amada owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 18 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 4,900 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Amada joined GDMPC. Amada wants to make improvements to her house one day.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks or Filipino native delicacies and viands

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with 4 children, ages 10, 17, 18 and 30. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Gloria is involved in seaweed farming. She earns 13,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Gloria works hard to improve her business and keep her family healthy. She requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, and other farming supplies. Gloria hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour, cassava flour, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Tusimire Kayabuhire Group

texts.en: Leonard is a 56-year-old married man with seven children living in Hioma, Uganda. For three years he has been a member of the above mentioned group. He has owned a retail shop for twenty years and with the proceeds he has been able to construct a house for his residence. He has been a member of this group for over 3 years and this is their 14th cycle loan. He and his members face challenges of high price fluctuations and customers paying late. He hopes to expand his business to new markets and also to educate his children. He intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise like soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca  es de la ciudad de Caacupé, tiene 37 años, es casada y cuenta que tiene hijos, por quienes ella se esfuerza, y quienes son la razón de su lucha diaria.
 La Sra. Blanca elabora y vende riquísimas tortas con la ayuda de su hijo. Cuenta que gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ya se hizo una buena clientela, la cual siempre acude a ella cuando tienen acontecimientos. Su sueño es poder tener una gran pastelería y así seguir creciendo en sus negocios.
Se acerca a la fundación y a Kiva para solicitar un crédito, el cual quiere invertir en la compra de azúcar y de dulce de leche en cantidad, los cuales son sus insumos principales para sus tortas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Blanca is from the city of Caacupé.  She is 37 years old and is married.  She tells us that she has children, and they are the reason why she struggles hard each day and gives her maximum effort.

Blanca makes and sells delicious cakes with the help of her son.  She tells us that, thanks to the good quality of her products, she already has a good group of customers who always come to her when they have special events.  Her dream is to be able to have a big pastry shop, so that in this way she  could grow her business.

She approached the Fundacion and Kiva to request a loan that she will use to purchase sugar and caramel in large quantities, because these are the main ingredients for her cakes.  She appreciates this opportunity, because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy sugar and caramel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks.

loans.name: Todozia

texts.en: Todozia is a 52-year-old widow with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on her since all her children are still in school. She has been selling coffee for two years and she started with 50,000 shillings and now has 500,000 shillings as working capital. Her hardship is theft. Her personal goal is educating children and her business goal is expanding her business into new markets and having a more secure coffee store. Todozia wants money to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Chakechake Group

texts.en:
Helena, who is in her late 40s, is married with five children who go to school. She has a business of selling new clothes, second-hand clothes, and fabrics. She has been selling door-to-door for five years now.  She works from 11:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. (for three hours only) daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to re-stock missing items, pay school fees, and start selling fabrics.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to buy more new clothes, second-hand clothes, and fabrics to re-sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a shop for selling her items.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Chakechake" which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes, second-hand clothes, and fabrics to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
