Mary's main work is raising and selling animals such as turkeys, ducks, chickens, pigs, and goats.  She feeds them concentrated feed and, when they reach the right size and weight, she sells them to wholesale merchants in the area.  She has been doing this work for four years.  Also, she learned this work from her parents; that is, she knows the field perfectly.  Her husband also helps her in these activities.

The sum of the loan granted is 600 nuevos soles (PEN), and it will be to buy feed such as corn, purina, and vitamins, and to repair the corrals.  In this way she will continue to grow in her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed such as corn, purina, and vitamins, and to repair the corrals.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 50 years old. He lives in a village of Tskaltubo District, West Georgia with his wife – Maka and 82-year-old mother. The family has a vineyard with 100 grapevines. Michael makes wine and sells it in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 200 Laris per month (including the pension of Michael’s mother). According to Credo’s estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Michael requested credit for building a greenhouse. He already has metal construction for the greenhouse. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Michael will purchase a polyethylene cover and construct the greenhouse. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for purchasing fertilizers. Michael will grow cucumbers and tomatoes during the summer and fall months and greens during winter and spring. He will sell harvested products at the Kutaisi market. The income of the family will significantly increase and Michael will be able to create better living conditions for his wife and mother. Along with the above-mentioned, in the future the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and polyethylene for construction of his greenhouse

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is taking out another loan of Ksh 50,000 to expand the existing business. He plans to top up the loan and purchase another motorbike. Since the previous loan, his living standards have improved. He is very grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the loan given.

loans.use: to top up the loan and purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Senobia

texts.es:
Senobia tiene 47 años, vive con Urbano, el padre de sus 6 hijos, de los cuales, sólo viven con 3 de ellos de 18, 14 y 10 años. Ella y su familia habitan en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa en Chanchamayo.

Ella es una mujer de buenos valores y de carácter amigable. Se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió desde que era pequeña al lado de sus padres. Tiene media parcela donde produce plátanos y yucas, en otro terreno cultiva frutas cítricas como; naranjas, mandarinas, tanyelos, lima dulce, etc. Pero el producto que le brinda mayores ganancias en pocas ventas es el achiote, utilizando como colorante natural. "Solo medio terreno me bota como 500 kilos de achiote y cada kilo está a 5 soles, hay años en que sube hasta a 11 soles", menciona afirmando su rentabilidad.
Senobia recibe el apoyo de su esposo para estas arduas labores, pero hay días en que el trabajo es más cansado por lo que contratan jornaleros a quienes paga por día.
Gracias a su esfuerzo Senobia logró formar 3 hijos, ya mayores, y lo continuará haciendo con los menores. Ahora se encuentra en la cosecha de cítricos; pero uno de sus próximos objetivos es probar con la siembra de café, para ello buscará un terreno lejano, cuyo clima sea adecuado para este producto.

Éste es su préstamo número 8 de MFP y por eso se dispone a pagar con responsabilidad las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", un grupo bien organizado y colaborador.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá pagar a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de cítricos y quienes también apoyarán en la cosecha del achiote.
texts.en:
Senobia is 47 years old. She lives with Urbano, the father of her 6 children, and 3 of her children who are aged 18, 14 and 10. She and her family live in their own house in an indigenous community in Chanchamayo.

She is a woman with good values and a friendly nature. She works in agriculture, an activity which she learnt from her parents as a child. She has a half plot of land where she produces bananas and cassava, and on another plot of land she cultivates citrus fruits such as oranges, mandarins, tangelos, sweet limes, etc. But the product which brings her the highest income in few sales is the annatto, used as a natural colourant. "Just half a plot of land provides me with around 500 kilos of annatto and each kilo is worth 5 soles - some years the price rises up to 11 soles", she says confirming its profitability.  

Senobia receives the support of her husband for this arduous work, but on some days the work is more tiring so she hires labourers who she pays by the day. 

Thanks to her effort, Senobia has educated 3 of her children, now adults, and she will continue to do the same with the younger children. She is currently engaged in harvesting the citrus fruits, but one of her next goals is to try sowing coffee. To do this she will look for a plot of land far away, where the climate is more suitable for this product. 

This is her eighth loan from MFP and as a result she is ready to pay her quotas responsibly. She belongs to the communal bank "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", a well-organised and collaborating group.  

With the money which she is requesting, she will be able to pay the labourers who will clean her fruit crops and provide assistance with the annatto harvest.

loans.use: to hire day labourers for her crops.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married with 2 children. She is 65 years old and lives in Sumasap, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Zenaida sells health supplements and ionizer gadgets to earn a living and has had this business for almost a year. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 20,000 to be used for purchasing additional health supplements and ionizer gadgets for sale.

Zenaida has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional health supplements and ionizer gadgets for sale

loans.name: Godoy

texts.es:
Godoy tiene 26 años, vive con Nelia, con quien tiene 2 hijos, de 5 y 2 años de edad. Esta joven familia vive en una casa rústica, pero propia, ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.

Él es agricultor, aprendió esta actividad cuando tenía 16 años. A su corta edad ya trabajaba en los terrenos de sus padres, así aprendió sobre la actividad con la que actualmente mantiene  a su familia. También se dedica a las labores de construcción como albañil, ahora se está encargando de construir un segundo ambiente del local comunal. 
En los dos terrenos de cultivo que posee produce yucas y plátanos, pero ahora quiere aumentar su producción habilitando otro lote de terreno. Godoy espera de ayuda financiera para sembrar mamones de plátano que ofrecerán sus primeros frutos en año y medio.

Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete en pagar puntualmente las cuotas, como anteriormente. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki” y se siente identificado con el grupo por tener socios activos y decididos.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará los mamones de plátano y bolsas de abono orgánico para iniciar una nueva plantación.
texts.en:
Godoy is 26 years old. He lives with Nelia, with whom he has 2 children, 2 and 5 years old. This young family lives in a house that is rustic, but their own. It is located in a native community in Chanchamayo.

He is a farmer. He learned this activity when he was 16 years old. At his young age he had already worked on his parents' land. This is how he learned about the activity with which he now supports his family. He also does construction work such as bricklaying. Right now he is building a second room for the community hall.

In the two plots of land that he owns, he grows yucca and bananas, but now he wants to increase his production by outfitting another plot of land. Godoy is hoping for financial help in order to plant banana plants that will offer their first fruits in a year and a half.

This is his 8th loan with MFP, so he promises to be punctual with his repayments, as before. He belongs to the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" ("The Little Roses of Ubiriki") communal bank. He identifies with the group because it has active and determined members.

With the money he is now requesting, he will purchase banana plants and bags of organic fertilizer in order to start planting in a new field.

loans.use: to purchase banana plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Luis Jacinto

texts.es: Luis Jacinto ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida en los cultivos de café, pues fue su padre quien le enseñó todo lo relacionado con la producción de esta planta. Actualmente Luis Jacinto tiene 57 años, una esposa y 3 hijos a quienes les ha enseñado, al igual que lo hizo su padre, a trabajar en el campo para ganarse la vida de forma honesta. Además del cultivo de café Luis Jacinto también se dedica a la producción de caña y de ganado, actividades que le ayudan a tener ingresos durante los meses en que apenas están floreciendo sus matas de café. La meta principal de Luis Jacinto como cafeticultor es tener más plantas sembradas en los próximos meses, pues actualmente tiene un promedio de 1,600 plantas por hectárea y en base a su experiencia sabe que puede llegar a tener hasta 2,000 plantas por hectárea sin que esto afecte la calidad del café que produce y por eso el necesita un crédito. Las plantas que sembrará ahora le estarán dando frutos en 3 años pero con la producción de su próxima cosecha podrá obtener el recurso necesario para pagar su crédito. Él sabe que si invierte de manera correcta su dinero dentro de poco tiempo obtendrá ganancias las cuales le servirán para hacer crecer sus actividades alternas, lo cual se verá reflejado en un mejor estilo de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Luis Jacinto has been engaged in planting coffee basically all his life, as it was his father who taught him everything about the production of this plant. Luis Jacinto is now 57, he is married and has 3 children to whom he is teaching how to work in the fields to honestly earn their living, just as his father did with him. On top of planting coffee, Luis Jacinto also engages in growing sugar cane and in breeding cattle, two activities that help him earn money during the months in which his coffee bushes are in bloom. As a coffee grower, Luis Jacinto’s main goal is to plant more shrubs in the next few months. At the moment he has about 1,600 plants per hectare, and he knows from experience that he can plant up to 2,000 shrubs per hectare without affecting the quality of the coffee he produces; for this reason he is requesting a loan. The shrubs he will plant will bear fruit in 3 years’ time, but with the production of his next harvest he will get the necessary resources to repay his loan. He knows that if he correctly invests his money he will get an income in a short time, and this will help him make his other activities grow: this, in turn, will grant a better standard of living for him and his family.

loans.use: Comprar planta de café para renovar sus parcelas

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos de 42 años de edad vecino de la localidad de huatusco, veracruz. vive con su esposa y 3 hijos, estudio solo hasta los 18 años desde hace diez años su madre le pido que se hiciera cargo de las parcelas de las cuales hoy es propietario teniendo que aprender por completo todo lo relacionado con el cultivo y la producción del café, Juan Carlos es productor de café orgánico y en sus tiempos libres realiza la mayor parte de las labores culturales como son el chapeo, la poda y la cosecha. sus metas como productor de café es poder renovar su plantación ya que algunas plantas son muy viejas y ya no tiene buena producción,para lograr tal meta pide un crédito el cual ocupara para comprar plantas para realizar la reforestación  así como también para el pago de las labores culturales que realizara para la preparación de su finca. de esta manera el vera reflejado su inversión y de igual forma aumentara su calidad de vida aunado a esto el podra cumplir sus sueños que son el de seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 42, lives near the town of Huatusco, Veracruz, with his wife and three children.  He studied until the age of 18.  Ten years ago his mother asked him to take charge of the plots of land that he now owns.  He had to learn everything related to growing and producing coffee.

Juan Carlos is a producer of organic coffee.  In his spare time he does the majority of the agricultural work such as cutting the grass with machetes, pruning, and the harvest.  His goal as a coffee producer is to be able to renew his plantation because some plants are very old and no longer produce well.

To achieve such a goal he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy plants to do the reforestation as well as to pay for the agricultural work he will do to prepare his farm.

In this way he will see his investment reflected and also will improve his quality of life.  In addition to this, he will be able to realize his dream, which is to continue supporting his children so they will finish their professional studies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and plants.

loans.name: Deisy De La Paz

texts.es:
Deisy, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 7 y 2 años de edad, tres de ellos están estudiando, Deisy se dedica a la venta de antojitos (empanadas, pasteles, tamales), lleva tres años en el negocio, lo aprendió con su madre, hoy en día lo realiza por el afán de aportar en la casa y ayudar con los gastos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, plátanos, papas, aceite, condimentos, que son su materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos, con este préstamo tendrá los recursos para poder comprarse todo lo necesario y poder aumentar su producción para la venta.
La aspiración de Deisy es dentro de algún tiempo instalar una tienda, en la que pueda ofrecer varios productos no perecederos y además los antojitos, desde su propia casa.
texts.en:
Deisy lives with her husband and four children who are 14, 12, 7 and 2 years old; tres currently are studying.  Deisy works selling fast food snacks (turnovers, cakes, tamales).  She’s been in business three years having learned it from her mother.  Today she does it with the objectrive of providing for her home and to help cover expenses.

She’s asking for a loan to buy corn, bananas, potatoes, oil and condiments that are the raw materials for making her food.  With this loan she’ll have the resources to be able to buy everything she needs and be able to increase production for sales.

Deisy’s hope is that is time she will be able to open a store to sell non-perishable items as well as  the snacks from home.

loans.use: to buy corn, bananas, potatoes, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Berthilde

texts.en: Berthilde is 30 years old. She is married to a businessman. She has been selling charcoal for three years. She has requested a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. With the profits from her business, she plans save capital to increase the volume of charcoal she is able to sell.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Blanca de 61 años de edad, es soltera por viudez desde hace 15 años, tiene 6 hijos de 9,16, 18,19, 22 y 24 años de edad, vive en una aldea rural de Santa cruz de Yojoa.

Tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura. Cultiva maíz, frijoles y café, tiene una manzana de cultivo y la producción la vende en el mercado local, la mayor parte llegan los compradores a su casa. Esta finca se la dejo su esposo y es bien administrada por ella y sus hijos, dedicándole el tiempo necesario al cultivo.
Esta solicitando el séptimo préstamo de 10,000 lempiras el cual lo utilizara para  seguir comprando fertilizantes y abonos  para un buen mantenimiento de la finca de café, cultivo de maíz y Frijoles ya que son sus rubros principales de donde ella obtiene los ingresos necesarios del hogar.  
Debido a los prestamos ella esta logrando tecnificar mas su finca para seguir obteniendo mejores cosechas.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para darle una buena educación a sus hijos e ir mejorando un nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Blanca, 61, has been single due to widowhood for the last 15 years.  She has six children who are 9, 16, 18, 19, 22 and 24 years old.  She lives in a rural village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

She’s been working in agriculture for 30 years.  She grows corn, beans and coffee.  She has a manzana [Central American unit of land measurement] of land in production and she sells her products in the local market but most of her customers come by her house.  Her husband left her the farm and it’s well run by her and her children; they put in the necessary time for the crops.

This is her seventh loan.  It’s for 10,000 lempiras that she’ll use to buy fertilizer and to plant and maintain coffee, corn and bean crop, which are her main source of income for her home.  She’s managed to add technological advances to her farm and to cover her children’s educational expenses.  Her goal is to continue working in order to give her children a good education and a better life.

loans.use: to provide crop maintenance and to plant basic grains.

location.town: La Boquita, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena, se dedica a la venta de enchape y cosméticos de empresas como AVON, vive en casa propia con sus hijos y hermanos, Lorena se dedica a comercializar cosméticos, lo aprendió desde joven, tiene una experiencia de 15 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de unos pedidos de productos cosméticos y enchape en diferentes estilos, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar su inventario e incrementar las ganancias.
La aspiración de Lorena es crecer en el comercio de cosméticos y enchape, desarrollándose como comerciante para poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lorena sells plated jewelry and cosmetics from companies, such as Avon. She lives in her own home with her children and her siblings. Lorena sells cosmetics since she learned this trade as a young woman. She has 15 years of experience.

Lorena is currently requesting a loan so that she can submit a few orders for cosmetics and plated jewelry in different styles. This loan will help improve her inventory so that she can increase her earnings. Lorena aspires to grow in the business of offering cosmetics and plated jewelry, develop as a merchant, and offer her family a better future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and plated jewelry.

loans.name: La Fuente De Bendicion 7 Group

texts.en:
Hirza is one of the members of La Fuente de Bendicion (The Source of Blessing) 7. They are five micro-entrepreneurs in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area. Hirza is the mother of five children and they live together with her long-term partner in a rural village outside the town. She started selling clothes nine years ago.

Hirza is receiving her 10th loan. She repaid her previous loans on time and made good investments. She is planning to use her new loan to purchase miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics, etc., for her business, which she started with a loan she received from Esperanza almost 9 years ago where she took her first three loans from us, she stopped taking loans from Esperanza for approximately a three year, and she started again, since this second chances she has taken 7th other loans.

Hirza will use the profits to continue rebuilding her house. Little by little, she plans to finish building it. Her most important challenge is to continue improving her business. She is really focused on helping her children to get a better education, good health and a better life.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, and other miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel tiene 18 años, es una joven que vive con su madre y hermanos menores en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.
Su padre falleció hace poco y ahora ella debe apoyar a su madre en las labores del campo. Se dedican al cultivo de achiote, paltas y naranjas. “Es rentable, los cítricos se venden bien estos meses, cada canasta está a 18 soles”, comenta. El naranjal bota sus frutos cada 15 días.
Ella y su madre poseen 5 parcelas de terreno, por eso asegura que no le faltará el dinero para pagar los préstamos que solicite.
Al mismo tiempo se encarga de atender su tienda de abarrotes y comestibles que han instalado en su casa, lleva 2 años en esta actividad.
Gracias al trabajo coordinado, ella y su madre pueden mantener a su familia, cubriendo las necesidades básicas. Ahora quieren ampliar la tienda, comprando más productos y no descuidar a sus clientes frecuentes.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, dice que pagará sin dificultad las cuotas mensuales. Ella ingresó al banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki” por recomendación de vecinos, donde se siente cómoda de tener compañeros confiables.
Raquel invertirá el dinero que solicita en la compra de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad para su negocio. También pagará a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Raquel is 18 years old and lives with her mother and younger brothers in an indigenous community of Chanchamayo. Her father recently passed away, and now she needs to support her mother in her work in the fields. They grow avacados, oranges and achiote. "It is profitable; the oranges are selling well at the moment. Every basket brings in 18 soles ", she said. They harvest fruit from the orange grove every 15 days. She and her mother have 5 parcels of land; thus it is certain that she will have the money to repay the loans she is seeking. At the same time she has set up her own shop in her house where she sells groceries and supplies. She has been doing this for two years. Thanks to their coordinated work, she and her mother can take care of their family, covering their basic expenses. Now they want to expand the shop, purchasing more products and taking good care of their regular customers. This will be her first loan with MFP. She says she will be able to make the monthly repayments without difficulty. She joined the communal bank “Las Rositas de Ubiriki” upon the recommendation of her neighbors, and she feels comfortable in this group and has trust in her fellow members. Raquel will invest the money she is seeking in the purchase of groceries and other products for her business. She will also use the money to pay laborers with whom she will contract to harvest her crops.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 22 años, vive con Walter, con quien tiene 2 hijos; de 3 años y otro de 8 meses de nacido. Viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Rosa en Chanchamayo.

Ella es una joven que trabaja con dedicación por el futuro de su familia. Desde que unió su vida a la de Walter empezó a trabajar en lo que pudo, pero con la inteligencia que la caracteriza hace dos meses decidió abrir un negocio de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. "Empecé vendiendo bebidas heladas, ahora mi tienda está bien surtida, me va bien", comenta.
Así también, cuenta con sembríos de naranjas y plátanos, para ello arrienda terrenos que paga con dinero y con los frutos que cosecha. Hace un año que se dedica a las labores del campo con la ayuda de su esposo. La mayor parte del tiempo está en su tienda y cuidando a sus pequeños hijos, por ello debe de contratar personal operario para trabajar sus tierras. Ruth menciona que recién está empezando a formar un negocio estable para sustentar a su familia, pero confía que con el apoyo de los préstamos y su esfuerzo puede lograr una calidad de vida decente para sus hijos.

Esta es la primera vez que Ruth solicita un crédito de MFP, por esa razón está decidida a pagar las cuotas puntualmente. Se integró al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", donde se siente cómoda y a gusto de tener compañeros responsables.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mercadería necesaria para surtir su negocio de abarrotes. Lo restante será para pagar al personal que limpiará sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 22 years old.  She lives with Walter, with whom she has two children who are three years old.  She is also 8 months pregnant with a third child.  They live in their own house in the indigenous community of Santa Rosa in Chanchamayo.

She works with great dedication for the future of her family.  Since she joined her life with Walter's, she started to work where she could find employment, but with her characteristic intelligence, she decided two months ago to open a business selling groceries and basic supplies.  "I started out selling frozen drinks, and now my store is well-stocked", she said. 

She also rents plots where she grows oranges and bananas; she pays the rent with the money she makes from the fruit that she harvests.  She has been doing this for one year with the help of her husband.  She spends the majority of her time in her store and taking care of her small children.  Thus, she needs to hire help someone to help her in the fields.  She says that the her business has recently begun to stabilize and allow her to sustain her family, but she is confident that with the support of these loans and her effort she will be able to achieve a better quality of life for her children.

This is the first loan Ruth is seeking from MFP.  For this reason she is determined to make her repayments punctually.  She joined the communal bank "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", where she feels comfortable and enjoys having responsible companions.

With the funds she is seeking, she will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.  The remainder will be to pay the laborers who harvest her crops.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: El Tesoro Group

texts.en:
Negra is the coordinator of this group, which is named El Tesoro (The Treasure). The group is located in one of the rural communities of San Pedro de Macoris that surround sugarcane fields, known as 'Bateyes.' Negra is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business, which she conducts by walking; she sells miscellaneous products such as clothes, underwear, and cosmetics. She is also the mother of two children. She lives alone with her long-term partner because their children live separately in their own homes.

Negra is receiving her 7th loan from Esperanza International after having successfully repaid all her previous loans. She started her business with her first loan from Esperanza almost four years ago. She will use this loan to purchase clothes, underwear, and cosmetics for her business. She will reinvest her profits in her business because May and June are good months for sales. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothes, underwear, cosmetics, etc. for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 27 años, vive con Jaime, el padre de sus 2 hijos, de 7 y 4 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, es decir cuando llegó a vivir a esa zona al iniciar su familia junto a su esposo. El trabajo del campo es cansado pero a ella le gusta porque se distrae mientras limpia sus cultivos. En todos estos años aprendió a cultivar diversos productos como; las frutas cítricas (naranjas, tanyarinas, mandarinas, tanyelos, lima dulce), achiote, plátanos y yucas. “La mayor parte de mi tiempo la paso en el campo, limpiando mis chacras de la mala yerba”, menciona. Así también se encarga de fertilizar sus terrenos con la ayuda de su esposo y algunos jornaleros que contrata. Su negocio de venta de frutas al por mayor es rentable. “Cada mes envío plátano, achiote y cítricos hacia Lima (ciudad capital). El año pasado coseché 400 kilos de achiote sólo de media parcela y las ventas fueron muy buenas”, menciona orgullosa.
Olga quiere abrir un negocio de comida en el puerto de su comunidad, allí piensa ofrecer desayunos y almuerzos a los transeúntes. Confía en su esfuerzo y dedicación.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso dice que pagará las cuotas puntualmente. Ella se acaba de integrar al banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki”, un grupo sólido y responsable.
Con el dinero que solicita podrá adquirir semillas de yuca y fertilizantes para sus cultivos de plátanos.
texts.en: Olga is 27 years old and lives with Jaime, the father of her two children, aged 4 and 7 years. They live together in their own house in the indigenous community of Chanchamayo. She has worked in agriculture for 8 years; she started this at the same time she arrived in this area to start her family with her husband. The work in the fields is tiring but she likes it because it is enjoyable to harvest her crops. In all these years she has learned to cultivate many different crops, such as citrus fruits (oranges, tangerines, mandarins, tangelos, sweet limes), achiote, bananas and yucas. "I spend the majority of my time pulling weeds in my fields", she says. She also fertilizes her land with the help of her husband and day laborers that she hires. Her business of selling fruit is profitable. "Every month I send bananas, achiote and citrus fruits to Lima (the capital city). Last year I harvested 400 kilograms of achiote from just half a plot, and the sales were very good", she proudly adds. Olga wants to open a business seling food near the entrance of her community. She wishes to offer breakfast and lunch to people who are passing through. She is confident in her dedication and efforts in this endeavor. This will be her first loan through MSP and says that she will make her repayments punctually. She just joined the communal bank “Las Rositas de Ubiriki”, a solid and responsible group. With the proceeds from the loan she will be able to aquire yuca seeds and fertilizer for her banana trees.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cherus

texts.en:
Cherus is 32 years old and lives in Lower Rizal, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

Cherus sells snacks to earn a living and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase sugar, flour and bananas for her snack vending business.

Cherus has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour and bananas for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Kaingu

texts.en: Kaingu is taking out another loan of 50,000 KES to expand his existing business. The loan will enable him to purchase a motorbike. His goal is to open a shop in the future. The previous loan allowed him to increase his monthly income. His standard of living has improved.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 48 years old. He is the father of three children between the ages of five and fifteen, all of whom attend school. 

He has been in the business of selling fruits. He believes in his business and wants to further expand it by requesting a loan to add more oranges and mangoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Notre emprunteur est un jeune menuisier mètallique, agè de 40 ans qui s' active depuis plus de 5 ans dèja.Il s'appelle Ousmane et est propriètaire d'un atelier artisanal ou il se dèbrouille pour gèrer sa dèpense quotidienne. Il a dèjà eu 2 crèdits à l' IMCEC et veut un renouvellement pour l'achat de fer, taule, pour fabriquer des portes et des fenetres destinès à la commercialisation.Il commence sa journèe à 8h et la termine à 20h.
Ousmane gère la location de son atelier, la dèpense quotidienne,l' eau et l' èlectricitè.
Il projette d'ouvrir un grand atelier dans l'avenir et d'augmenter sa production.
texts.en:
The borrower, age 40, is a young sheet metal worker who has been actively involved in his profession for more than five years already.  His name is Ousmane.  He owns a small fabrication shop and manages his daily expenses quite well.  

He has already received two loans from UIMCEC and is requesting a new loan for the purchase of iron and steel sheets which will be used to manufacture doors and windows for resale.  His work day starts at 8 AM and ends at 8PM.  Ousmane manages expenses related to the renting out of his shop, he also takes care of daily expenses such as water and electricity.  His future plan is to open a larger shop and to increase his production.

loans.use: to buy iron and steel sheets to manufacture windows and doors for resale.

loans.name: La Reforma 2, 3, 5 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is the coordinator of her group named La Reforma 2, 3, 5 & 7 (Reform). She has a long-term partner and is a mother with 4 children, all living with her in a simply structured home, in a rural village of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugarcane industry. The main economic activity here is the free-trade zone, a cement factory, and other businesses.

Cristina has been selling gasoline for approximately 10 and a half years. She used some money she had to start the business. She plans to use this loan to buy more gallons of gasoline. She will reinvest the profits in her business so she can expand her sales and supply more clients. This is her 10th loan with Esperanza International, and she is very excited about it. She has been investing all her loans in her business, which has made it possible to respond to the need for gasoline in her community. She sells her gasoline at a small stall next to one of the main roads in her village. Cristina thanks you all for your support of her group's dreams.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 21 años, es una joven soltera que vive con su madre en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura y actualmente cuenta con 2 lotes de terrenos de cultivos que sus padres le otorgaron para que sea independice. En ellos siembra plátanos, achiote, yuca y frutas cítricas. El trabajo es muy cansado, por eso recibe la ayuda de sus hermanos y padres, pero cuando las jornadas son intensas recurre a contratar jornaleros para las cosechas y la limpieza de sus cultivos. “Estos meses se vende bien los cítricos, el café también, aunque este año el precio está un poco bajo”, menciona. La mayor parte de su producción la negocia en su propia comunidad. Yanet está contenta con su labor, porque todo lo que obtiene es producto de su esfuerzo. Ahora espera producir otra parcela de yucas, para ello comprará semillas y fertilizantes.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar las cuotas sin dificultad, por su compromiso con la entidad. Ella ingresó a formar parte del banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki”, donde comparte gratos momentos y apoyo económico.
Invertirá el dinero el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de semillas de yucas y bolsas de abono orgánico para una nueva siembra.
texts.en: Yanet is 21 years old, single and lives with her mother in the community of Chanchamayo, Peru. For the past three years she has made a living in agriculture and currently has two plots of lands that her parents gave her to become independent. She plants bananas, annatto, yucca and citrus fruits on the land. The work is very tiring, so she receives help from her parents and siblings, but when the tasks are intense she hires day laborers to harvest and clean the crops. "These past months the citrus fruits are selling well, coffee too, although the price this year is a little low," she says. The majority of her produce she sells to her own community. Yanet is content with her work because she sees her efforts bear fruit. Now she hopes to produce another plot of yucca, for which she will buy seeds and fertilizer. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments with ease. She joined the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, where she shares pleasant moments and economic support. She plans to invest the money she is requesting in the purchase of yucca seeds and bags of organic fertilizer for the new harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 48-year-old widow. She sells vegetables and fruits, and will use this loan to buy more mangoes, tree tomatoes, passion fruits and tomatoes to sell. Beatrice wants to reinvest her profits in the business because it has helped her sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, tree tomatoes, passion fruits and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Twungubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait partie du groupe Twungubumwe  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  33 ans et est marié à Elysée. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, dont 1 étudie.
Il fait le commerce de boutique(riz,haricot,savons,...)  depuis 2 ans. 

Il  est à son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de boutique(riz, haricot, savons,..,) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il espère améliorer la situation familiale grâce aux crédits de Turame Community Finance S.a.
texts.en:
Etienne is part of the Twungubumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and is married to Elysée. They have three children, and one of them goes to school. 

He’s been working in a boutique (rice, beans, soaps) for the past 2 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With his KIVA credit, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items for his boutique (rice, beans, soaps) to resell and increase his earnings. 

Over the next few years, he would like to improve his family's status with the help of loans from Turame Community Finance SA.

loans.use: he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of items for his boutique (rice, beans, soaps) to resell and increase his earnings.

loans.name: Kasaija

texts.en: Kasaija is 47 years old. He has seven children and lives in Hioma,Uganda. He owns a retail shop, which he has been operating for five years. Kasaija's challenges are high price fluctuations and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. His family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house. Kasaija intends to use this loan to purchase general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and sugar, to sell

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es:
Joaquín tiene 44 años, vive con Sandra, con quien se unió hace poco. Ellos desean tener hijos, pero quieren adquirir algunas comodidades para su hogar primero, antes de recibir a los nuevos miembros de la familia. Viven en la casa que construyeron en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo. 

Él lleva 23 años viviendo en esa zona, desde entonces de dedica al cultivo de cítricos, café y achiote, para ello cuenta con 8 parcelas de terreno distribuidas en distintas partes. "Me conviene sembrar más café y achiote, su cosecha es una vez al año, pero su venta es inmediata", menciona. Actualmente se encuentra cosechando naranjas y mandarinas, las cuales vende en su propia comunidad, ya que los compradores ya conocen de la calidad de sus frutos y lo visitan para adquirir sus productos. Con el apoyo de los jornaleros, a quienes contrata, puede abarcar las 8 extensiones de cultivos que posee. El trabajo no es nada fácil, por eso Sandra también da de su parte llevando la comida y las bebidas frías, y cuando termina con la comida, coge las herramientas de trabajo de campo para ayudarlo.
Sus planes más cercanos son de mejorar su producción de café y achiote, para ello comprará nuevas plantitas que colocará en los espacios vacíos de sus sembríos y además cambiará el cafetal que ya no produce, por plantas nuevas. 

Éste es el préstamo número 8 que tiene con MFP. Pertenece al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", donde se siente satisfecho del trabajo desplegado en todos estos ciclos como socio responsable.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá pagar el servicio de los jornaleros para la limpieza de sus cultivos. Con lo restante comprará bolsas de abono para sus sembríos de cítricos y cafetales.
texts.en: Joaquín is 44 years old and lives with Sandra, whom he has been with for a little while. They want to have children, but they want to acquire some comforts for their home first before welcoming new members of the family. They live in a house they built in the native community of Chanchamayo, Peru. Joaquín has lived in the area for 23 years, and since then has made a living growing citrus fruit, coffee and annatto distinctly distributed over eight plots of land. "It suits me to plant more coffee and annatto. It's harvested once a year, but it sells immediately," he says. Currently he is harvesting oranges and mandarins, which he sells within his community since the buyers already know the quality of his fruit and visit him to acquire the products. With the support of hired day laborers he can cover the eight areas of crops he has. The work is far from easy, so Sandra does her part by bringing food and cold drinks, and when the meals are finished she picks up field-working tools to help out. Joaquín's plans for the near future are to increase his coffee and annatto production by buying new seedlings to put in the empty spaces and also changing out the coffee plants that aren't producing for new ones. This is his eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP. He belongs to the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, where he feels satisfied with the work carried out over all these loan cycles as a responsible member. With the money he is requesting, he plans to hire day laborers to clean his crops and use the rest to purchase sacks of fertilizer for his citrus and coffee plants.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer.

Restituta sells bananas and yams to her community. She also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. Restituta wants to be able to provide for all of her family's needs. She requested a loan to buy more bananas and yams to sell. She hopes for her small business to grow and for her family to have a more stable living.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and yams to sell

loans.name: Floride

texts.en: Florida is 40 years old. She is married to a businessman. They have eight children: six of them go to school and the other two are still too young. Florida has sold fruits for the past five years. With the loan, she will buy more passion fruits, tomatoes, and pineapples for selling. She plans to use the profits from the business to pay school fees for the children currently enrolled in school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for selling

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is a hardworking married woman with eight children living in Masindi, Uganda. She has a retail shop and the business is very profitable, despite challenges in high fuel and transportation costs, coupled with inflation. She desires to educate her children and expand her business into a supermarket. Delfina wants a loan to buy sugar and rice for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice for selling

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en: Jean Paul is 26 years old. He is single and very happy with his business of showing movies in the trading center he lives in. He normally burns CDs and DVDs for movies and songs. He has been in the business for the past three years. The profits from the business are projected to be reinvested into the same business for the better future of his business.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and burn CDs, along with making movies for selling

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is the mother of a single child who is enrolled in school. She operates a tailoring business from home, which serves her neighbors. She dreams of opening a tailoring and dress-making college in the future. Emily owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. She has been in this business for the past 10 years, previously selling fried potatoes. Credit defaulters pose her as a major challenge. She spends more on food over the month.
The loan of KES 25,000 will enable her to purchase clothing materials.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Rosa Marta

texts.es:
Rosa de 44 años de edad es originaria de la isla de Ometepe actualmente vive en Granada, soltera, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de quesillos un plato tipico y muy sabroso solicitado por los turistas que visitan la ciudad,  madre de 2 hijos. Inicio su actividad desde muy joven ayudándole a su mama, luego  decide independizarse se dedica a vender enchiladas(comida) para aportar con los gastos del hogar ya que salió embarazada de su primer hijo, después con el tiempo vio que la venta de quesillo  era muy buena pues le generaba  mas ganancias decide buscar a un amigo  que le ayudara a conseguir marteria prima mas barata, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos comercializando sus productos en la misma comunidad y en los alrededores de Granada. Cuenta con otros ingresos provenientes del esposo que le pasa remesas para los gastos del hogar.
Solicita el crédito para comprar queso, cebolla, vinagre, tortillas y crema que son parte de los ingredientes que se utilizan para la venta de quesillo, ella estima que el préstamo le ayudara ya que viene la temporada de mayores ventas podrá ofrecer mas cantidad del producto a su clientela, como meta próxima espera  pagar con las ganancias que le genere la venta de quesillo el préstamo para luego solicitar un nuevo crédito con el objetivo de hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, is originally from the island of Ometepe and today lives in Granada.  She lives on her own while her husband is away, and works as a food vendor selling quesillos, a typical and flavorful Mexican dish that is very popular with the tourists that visit the city.  She is a mother of two.  

She started making quesillos when she was very young helping by her mother.  She decided to start her own business and originally sold enchiladas to help with the expenses around the house during the time she was pregnant with her first child.  Later she discovered that she earned more money by selling quesillos and decided to work with a friend who could help her find better and cheaper ingredients.

Her children help her with the business, selling their products in Granada and the surrounding neighborhoods.  Her husband also helps with the household expenses by sending money home.  

She will use her loan to buy cheese, onions, vinegar, tortillas and sour cream, which are all ingredients that make up the quesillo.  Rosa hopes that the loan will help her since the busy season is approaching and she will be able to offer more products to her clients.  

After she pays off this loan she wants to use the profits combined with a new loan to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy cheese, onions, vinegar, tortillas, and sour cream

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are attending school. She operates a kiosk selling to her neighbors. Lack of enough capital is her major challenge. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Peris lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She dreams of opening a shop in the near future. She has been in this business for the last year.

With the loan of Ksh 20,000, she plans to purchase maize flour, beans, and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
 
Lida and her husband, using their motorcycle, are delivering breads and cakes to some sari-sari stores in their community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients in making breads, pastries, and cakes, like sugar, flour, and eggs. She will also pay for the gasoline for the motorcycle.

Lida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads, cakes, cookies, and pastries

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong is a 53-year-old married woman who has been residing in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a local rice farmer who plants and sells rice for her income. Her husband also works in the same business as her. Duong wants to provide basic living needs and good educations for her children, so she has a strong determination to achieve her goal. She presently is responsible for five children, one of whom is still single and attending high school. 

At the present, Duong is seeking a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to purchase extra farmland to improve her farming business. Someday, with good profits from the business, she will attain a successful life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase extra farmland to improve her farming business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 32 years old. She is the mother of four children and all of them go to school. She has been running a canteen for the past two years. The loan requested will be used for buying more fresh milk, sugar, breads, and sodas for selling in her canteen. With the profits, she will pay for the school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more fresh milk, sugar, breads, and sodas for selling

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo Mario y tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales sólo 4 viven con ellos. La casa donde viven es propia y está ubicada en una comunidad nativa del Perené.
Las actividades que realiza son varias; empezando el día atiende a familia para que ellos también inicien sus actividades diarias, al culminar sus labores del hogar se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivos. Actualmente cuenta con 5 lotes de tierras fértiles que su comunidad le brindó, en ellas siembra tanyarinas, achiote, café, plátano, yuca, carambolas y cacao. “Sembrar de todo me conviene mucho, porque cada producto se cosecha en meses distintos, así abastezco a mi familia en todo el año”, afirma. La producción de cítricos es común en su localidad, por eso los compradores llegan hasta sus sembríos para adquirir su producción. Así ahorra el pago de transporte. Sofía recibe el apoyo se su esposo, quien trabaja con entrega y dedicación a sus cultivos. Gracias a su esfuerzo pueden asegurar el alimento, vestido y educación de sus hijos. Sus metas más cercanas son de ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos y mejorar su producción, para eso deberá invertir en la compra de terrenos y fertilizantes.

Éste es su crédito número 8 con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Rositas de Ubiriki” y se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo tan unido y organizado.
El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para sus cítricos y cacao, cuya cosecha inicia este mes. También pagará a los operarios que contratará para estas faenas.
texts.en: Sofía is 46 years old, lives with her husband Mario and has six children, of whom only four live with them in a home they own in the native community of Perené, Peru. Sofía carries out a number of tasks. She starts the day tending to her family so they too begin their daily activities, and she dedicates herself to her fields of crops before finishing the day with her household responsibilities. She currently has five plots of fertile land that her community provided, on which she plants tangerines, annatto, coffee, bananas, yucca, star fruit and cocoa. "Planting everything suits me well because every crop is harvested in specific months, so my family is supplied for the entire years," she says. Producing citrus fruits is common in her community, so buyers arrive after the harvest to acquire her products, saving her transportation costs. Sofía receives the support of her husband, who works on delivering and tending the crops. Thanks to her hard work she has been able to feed, clothe and educate her children. Her near-term goals are to expand her plots and increase her production, for which she plans to invest in the purchase of land and fertilizer. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments. She belongs to the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, and feels good about being part of such a united and organized group. She plans to use the money she is requesting to purchase fertilizers for her citrus and cocoa crops, whose harvest beings this month. She will also hire workers to carry out these tasks.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and hire workers.

loans.name: Savong

texts.en:
Savong is 33 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a rural area of the Dambae district, Cambodia. He has no kids. He earns a living by selling soup in the village and he has been in this business for two years. With his current business, he can earn a daily income of up to US $63, of which he can manage to save only around US $9 per day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Savong with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, he wants to use this loan to buy construction materials to build a small store to sell soup and also buy necessary items for his business. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a decent store to serve more customers and also hopes to earn a larger income.

loans.use: to build a small store and buy necessary items for his soup business

loans.name: Evemi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EVEMI est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommé Candide, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Candide est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Alexis. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Candide vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Candide a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Candide mène comme activité la vente de divers, et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Candide vend aussi de façon secondaire de charbon de bois à son domicile depuis quatre ans. Candide s'approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Candide sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EVEMI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The EVEMI group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Candide, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. 

Candide is 30 years old and she is married to a man named Alexis. Candide and Alexis have two children, both in school and their dependents. Candide lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband. She left school at the secondary level.

Candide sells various goods, as well as mobile phone recharge cards.  Additionally, she has been selling charcoal, from her home, for the past four years.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Eager to better meet her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Candide is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the EVEMI group.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharge cards, bags of charcoal and other various goods.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
Benito tiene 42 años, vive con Isabel, con quien tiene 2 hijos, de 18 y 16 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.
Como hombre agricultor él tiene un carácter decidido para afrontar esta actividad y programar las siembras de tal manera que las fechas de cosecha coincidan con los meses donde el precio sea más favorable. Actualmente cuenta con 5 parcelas que están produciendo cítricos, café, plátanos y palta.  Benito vive en esa comunidad desde que tenía 8 años, por eso conoce muy bien la zona y sabe qué frutos producen con éxito. "Ahora la cosecha de naranjas y mandarinas es rentable. Sus precios son buenos", comenta. Así también, cuenta con 2 motocarros con los que ofrece el servicio de transporte a los pobladores de su localidad. Para el futuro, espera adquirir otros terrenos para sembrar café y mejorar su producción. "El café orgánico tiene más demanda", menciona.

Éste es su préstamo número 8 que tiene con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki", uno de los grupos más sólidos de la selva central. Por su parte, él muestra entusiasmo en las actividades que se desarrollan.
Con el dinero que solicita comprará una máquina “macheteadora” con la que optimizará el trabajo de limpieza de sus cultivos. Calcula que le costará 1600 soles.
texts.en: Benito is 42 years old and lives with Isabel, with whom he has two children, ages 18 and 16. They all live together in their own home in the native community of Chanchamayo, Peru. As a farmer, he has the character to take on this activity and schedules his plantings in such a way that his harvests coincide with the months where they will fetch the best prices. He currently has five parcels producing citrus fruits, coffee, bananas and avocado. Benito has lived in this community since he was 8 years old, so he is well known in the area and knows how to successfully grow fruit. "Right now harvesting oranges and mandarins is lucrative. The prices are good," he says. He also has two vehicles to transport the products locally. In the future, he hopes to add more land to plant coffee and increase his production. "Organic coffee has more demand," he says. This will be his eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to make his payments on time. He belongs to the "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, one of the tightest-knit groups in the area, and for his part, Benito shows enthusiasm for the group's activities. With the money he is requesting, he plans to purchase a machine to optimize the cleaning of his crops. He estimates it will cost him 1,600 soles.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to clean his crops.

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Robert. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie vend des produits vivriers (maïs, farine de manioc, etc.) dans sa boutique. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Marie désire augmenter son stock de produits. Pour ce faire, Marie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The MAHOUGNON group consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Marie, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.

Marie is married to a carpenter named Robert. Marie and Robert have three children, whom they financially support.  Some of their children attend school.  Marie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband. She has never attended school.

Marie sells food products (maize, cassava flour etc.) in her shop.

Eager to better meet her customers' needs and to boost her income, Marie would like to increase her stock of products. To this end, she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the MAHOUGNON group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and cassava flour.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 53 años, está casada y vive con dos de sus siete hijos. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Santa Rosa de Ubiriki en Chanchamayo.

A pesar de su edad, se entrega a las labores del campo con el mismo esfuerzo de hace 20 años, el mismo tiempo que lleva dedicándose a la agricultura. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Huancayo y llegó a la selva central para formar una familia y desde entonces aprendió a cultivar cítricos, yucas y piñas. Cuenta con una parcela de cítricos y siete de piñas. "Me conviene producir piñas, su precio es bueno y la demanda también, aunque su temporada sea de dos meses, me ayudo con la yuca", comenta. Con esta actividad pudo mantener a su numerosa familia y lo continúa haciendo. Ahora piensa cultivar otros productos como naranjas y mandarinas para surtir sus frutos y generar ingresos para otros meses.

Éste es su préstamo número 8 que tiene con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Victoria pertenece al banco comunal "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" y se siente contenta de ser parte de un grupo sólido y de personas responsables.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá comprar semillas de piña y bolsas de fertilizantes para sembrar más frutos. También pagará a los operarios quienes echarán el abono y limpiarán sus cultivos.
texts.en: Victoria is 53 years old, married and lives with two of her seven children in their own home in the native community of Santa Rosa de Ubiriki in Chanchamayo, Peru. Despite her age, Victoria has worked in the fields with the same vigor for the past 20 years, dedicating herself to agriculture. She is a native of the city of Huancayo and came to the central jungle to start a family, and since that time she learned how to grow citrus fruits, yucca and pineapple. She has a parcel of citrus fruit and seven of pineapple. "Growing pineapple suits me. The price is good and so is the demand, although its in season for only two months. It helps me with the yucca," she says. With this activity she was able to have a large family and continue working. Now she plans to grow other crops like oranges and mandarins to stock up on fruit and generate income during other months. This is her eighth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. Victoria belongs to "Las Rositas de Ubiriki" community bank, and feels good about being part of a united group of responsible people. She plans to use the money she is requesting to purchase pineapple seeds and bags of fertilizer to plant more fruits. She also will pay workers to take out the manure and clean her crops.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Soib

texts.ru: Соиб проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он 4 года. Кредит берет для приобретения новой машины.
texts.en: Soib lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 24 years old, married, and has one child.  He offers taxi services.  He has lived in this area for the past four years.  He is taking a loan to buy a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Elyana

texts.ru: Elyana 12 let kak vedet biznes v sfere torgovli. Ey 52 goda, ona zamujem I u nee dvoe vzroslix detey. Ona prodaet ovoshi, zelen I frukti. Ey pomogayut dvoe ee rabotnikov. Krome doxoda s ee biznesa ona poluchaet pensiyu. Ona xochet kupit mashinu dla togo chtobi perevozit produkti dla prodaji I v drugie rayoni. Elyana obratilas za summoy v 1000 AZN.
texts.en:
Elyana has been involved in small retail business for the past twelve years.  She is 52 years old, married, and she has two grown-up children.  

She sells greens, fruits and vegetables.  She has two people working with her.  Beside the income she makes from her business, she also receives a pension.  She wants to buy a car to transport her produce for resale to different districts.  Elyana is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport the products she sells to other villages.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells various items like softdrinks, vinegar, and eggs. Aside from the store, Ma. Magdalina also sells Avon products and home-cooked meals. She works hard to support herself and her family.

Ma. Magdalina is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and food vending inventory. She hopes to have a big business in the future. She also hopes to acquire a car.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and food vending inventory

loans.name: Toktogul

texts.ru:
Токтогул 59 лет, вдова, воспитала 6 детей. Токтогул работает учителем в школе села Кайынды - Булак и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, с 1977 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 6,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Токтогул на сегодняшний  день имеется  10 овец, 2 коровы с телятами и 1 лошадь.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтогул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Токтогул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Toktogul is 59 years old.  She is a widow, and she has raised six children. She works as a school-teacher in the village of Kaindy-Bulak.  

In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1977, starting her business with an initial amount of 6,000 som (KGS).  Toktogul currently owns one horse, ten sheep and two cows with their calves.  

In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS).  This loan will be used to purchase additional livestock.  Toktogul plans to invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her animal-husbandry business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosa Zenaida

texts.es:
ROSA ZENAIDA tiene 44 años de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijosen Gauaranda provincia de Bolívar.

ROSA ZENAIDA es profesora en un escuela. Solicita el crédito para comprar cabinas telefónicas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá emoprender un negocio.

La compra de las cabinas lo hará en Guaranda. El sueño es poder ampliar el negocio y comprar más cabinas.

El desafío que tiene es poder sacar una maestria. En el tiempo libre le gusta areglar la casa.
texts.en:
Rosa Zenaida is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and children in Guaranda, which is in Bolívar Province.

Rosa Zenaida is a teacher at a school. She is requesting a loan to buy telephone calling stations. With the help of this loan, she will be able to start a business. The purchase of the stations will be made in Guaranda. Her dream is to expand the business and acquire more stations. Rosa's challenge is being able to obtain a Master's degree.

In her free time, she enjoys fixing up her house.

loans.use: to buy telephone calling stations.

loans.name: Alogo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOGO est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans la même maison. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Irène, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Irène est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Albert. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Irène a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Irène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de trois ans que Irène mène comme activité la vente de condiments à son domicile. Irène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête d'une meilleure satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Irène sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOGO. le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The ALOGO group is comprised of three people who live in the same house. The representative of this group is Irene, and she’s the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the second time that this group has asked for financial support from ALIDé to expand its business. 

Irene is 32 years old and is married to a woodworker named Albert. The couple has three dependent children, some of whom go to school. Irene stopped going to school after elementary school. Irene lives with her husband and her children, and she and her husband take care of the various household responsibilities. 

For nearly 3 years now, Irene has been selling condiments out of her home. Irene buys her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of better satisfying her clients and growing her revenue, Irene and the other members of the ALOGO group are asking for their second loan from ALIDé. Their first loan was repaid.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments.

loans.name: Gloriefe

texts.en:
Gloriefe, single, 32 years old, resides at Migcanaway, Tangub City, Philippines. Gloriefe owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn her living. She's had 2 years of experience in this business. 

Each month, Gloriefe earns 6,000 PHP operating this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Gloriefe hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 58 years old and lives in Nailon,Tudela. She is married and has 2 children. 

Nelly has a general store. She has had this business for 20 years. Nelly has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.
She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Nelly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 22 years old. He is single, with the dedication of making himself a very renowned entrepreneur in the future. He sells shoes and has been in the business for four years. The profits from the business will be used for savings in order to accumulate capital to reinvest in the same business. He would love to see himself as a successful business man in the future.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, 47, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is widowed and has 5 children. She, together with her children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Elvira earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from the store, she has videoke machines. A videoke is a combined term for video karaoke. Elvira earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She operates a small area of her house as a small videoke machine rental, where people can hang out and sing. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Elvira is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elvira hopes to be able to expand her business soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 25 years old. She sells clothes for kids. She has been selling clothes for five years. She has requested a loan to buy more clothes for sale. The profits will be used for providing food for the family and build savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Brenda has a shop that sells RTWs (Ready to Wear clothing) and cosmetics. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more inventory of clothes to sell like blouses, t-shirts, pants, and underwear, as well as deodorant, herbal oils, and lotions.
Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy inventory of clothing to sell

loans.name: Ernesto De Jesus

texts.es:
Ernesto, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, uno de ellos esta fuera del hogar, casado, él es agricultor en pequeño, aprendió como ayudante y hoy en dia realiza su propia labor con 25 años de experiencia. 
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, semilla y pago de mozos, tambien pagara el alquiler del terreno, este préstamo le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para realizar la siembra, fortaleciendo su trabajo para poder ayudar a su familia en la alimentación.
El objetivo de Ernesto es comprarse un terreno propio, en el cual sembrar pudiendo agregar otros rubros para el mejoramiento de sus ingresos y el sustento familiar.
texts.en:
Ernesto lives with his wife and has three children. One of them is married and lives outside of their home. He is a small farmer who learned the trade as an assistant. Today he works on his own and has 25 years of experience.

Ernesto is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, herbicides, and seeds. He will also pay his workers and pay the rent on his farmland. This loan will help him to have everything he needs for planting. By strengthening his business, Ernesto will be able to feed his family. His goal is to buy his own land so that he can engage in additional activities that will improve his income for sustaining his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, seeds, and to pay his workers and the rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut, 50, is a widower living in the rural village of the Ratanak Mondul district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. He has four children, three of whom are still in school. He earns a living to feed his children through planting cassava and red maize. He supplements his income by farming rice on the three-hectare farmland. The main challenge for his business is the low crop yield which has made him earn less to support the family. His daily income earned from his current business is 20,000 KHR and can save only 5,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Mut with VisionFund. Now applying for a loan with VisionFund, he is going to use this loan to spend for land preparation and buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to increase his crop yields and earn more income to better feed and support his children.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and buy fertilizer for his farmland

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita is 50 years old and lives in Bliss Cabol-anonan,Tudela. She is married with 4 children. Marita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 2 years. Marita requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents. Marita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Marita hopes to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents for sale

loans.name: Johana Estefania

texts.es:
Johana tiene 22 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, cuando se caso se fue a vivir a la casa de la suegra y ella le enseño el negocio que conoce desde hace 30 años. Hoy en día Johana tiene un año y medio de dedicarse al negocio de los mariscos, ya conoce las especies que más se venden, nombres, precios promedio, época de venta y como prepararlos.

Toda la mercadería se la llegan a vender a la casa donde tiene el negocio. Ella tiene la ventaja que vive cerca de la playa, por que casi todos los pescadores son vecinos de ella y ellos mismos se encargan de distribuir la pesca en la zona para su comercialización.

Johann solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar mariscos, pescado, langosta, jaibas, pero sobre todo el camarón, ya que es el que tiene más demanda y es el más caro. Con la inversión dispondrá de dinero suficiente para expandir su venta más que todo en la compra de camarón y langosta. Así, ella se independizara, ya que hasta el momento trabaja junto con su suegra. Pero con el préstamo se le abrirán las puertas para comenzar con su propio negocio.

Su deseo es vivir en una casa propia en la misma zona y administrar su negocio por ella misma con propósitos de crecer.
texts.en:
Johana is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She previously devoted herself to doing household chores, but when she got married, she went to go live at her mother-in-law's house. Her mother-in-law taught her the business that she was in for 30 years. Today Johana has been in the business of selling seafood for a year and a half. She is already knowledgeable about what types of seafood sell the most, their names, their average prices, when certain seafood is in season, and how it should be prepared.

All of the merchandise is sold from her house, since that is where her business is located. She has the advantage of living near the beach, where almost all of the fishermen are her neighbors. They are the ones responsible for distributing the fish throughout the area in order to be sold.
