 Solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, barillla, eternit, ladrillo.

 Con la ayuda del crédito podrá realizar el arreglo de la vivienda para poder vivir en mejores condiciones porque la casa es muy pequeña.

La compras de los materiales lo har{a en Guaranda. el sueño es poder mantenerce en el trabajo, dar la educación a los hijos para que sean profesionales.

En el tiempo libre le gusta leer y realizar carteles de escritura.
texts.en: Jose Leonardo is 51 and is married with 3 children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.  He teaches in an elementary school.  He is requesting a loan to buy cement, bars, metal sheets, and bricks.  With the help of this credit, he will be able to make repairs to his home to be able to live in better conditions because his house is very small.  He will buy the materials in Guaranda.  His dream is to be able to maintain his job and to give his children an education so they can become professionals.  In his free time, he likes to read and make hand-written posters.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars, metal sheets, and bricks.

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael, 39, is the mother of three children between the ages of eleven and eighteen years. She has been farming for six years, and her farm mainly produces milk.

Abigael has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says that the loan will help her boost her farming income and provide milk for the family's consumption. She says animal diseases are her major business challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Bibiane

texts.en:
Bibiane is 53 years old and married with four children between 10 and 25 years old. She sells fertilizer, and she has been in this business for 4 years. 

Bibiane has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more fertilizer, which she will sell wholesale to farmers. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old, married to David, and blessed with three children, aged six, three, and two years. She runs a restaurant, a business she started four years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

Florence has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase 20 kg of rice, one bag of beans, 50 kg of sugar, and 40 litres of cooking oil to be used in the restaurant. The profit she earns will be reinvested in her business. Her dream is to grow her business and be financially stable. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 40 years old and an enterprising businesslady. She is married to Peter, who is a businessman. They are blessed with three children, aged 21, 17, and 14 years. She has been baking cakes for the past 14 years. Her monthly income of KES 10,000 is used to support her family. 

Lucy is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and an oven. She will use the remaining amount to rent a house for her business. With the anticipated profit, she will educate her children. Her hope and dream is to open a hotel (restaurant).

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and an oven and rent a space for her business

loans.name: Teodora Veronica

texts.es:
Teodora, está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en la tienda, comprándose productos para surtirla como condimentos, pastas, sopas, productos de higiene personal, con esto lograra mejorar el negocio y tener a la mano lo necesario para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, le dio la oportunidad de mejorar sus ventas, pues surtió el negocio de mucha mercadería, además logro terminar la construcción de un cuarto en la casa.
texts.en:
Teodora is requesting a loan in order to be able to invest in the store.  She will do this by purchasing products to stock the store.  She will buy products like condiments, pasta, soup, and personal hygiene products.  By doing this she will manage to improve her business.  She will also be able to have on hand what her customers need.

The previous loan had a positive impact.  It gave her the opportunity to improve her sales.  She stocked the business with a lot of merchandise.  She also managed to finish building a room in her house.

loans.use: to buy products like condiments, pasta, soup, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 58 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 7 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú hace 5 años. Es dueña de una tienda en la cual vende baterías para vehículos menores y vehículos pesados. Está agradecida con la institución por que le da muchas facilidades de préstamo para así hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar la condición económica de su familia. Las capacitaciones  que recibe en su Bancomunal le gustan mucho ya que ellas le enseñaron a ser responsable y no ser pesimista. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más baterías para vehículos para venderlos en su negocio.
texts.en: Irene is a member of the communal bank “Buena Suerte” (Good Luck). She is 58 years old, is a widow and has 7 children. She has been with FINCA Peru for 5 years. She owns a shop where she sells batteries for small and heavy vehicles. She is grateful to the institution because it provides her with many loan facilities to help her to expand her business and to improve her family's financial situation. She likes the training she receives from the communal bank very much since it has taught her to be responsible and not to be a pessimist. She is asking for a loan to buy more car batteries to resell in her business.

loans.use: to buy more car batteries to resell in her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married man. He has a son who is five years old. He describes himself to be honest and polite. He operates a tailoring retail store. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a busy town, and his primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from his customers. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy fabric. Earlier on, Peter had taken out loans of KES 80,000, 50,000 and 20,000. He managed to pay the whole amount owed. His business goal is to venture into the bakery business in addition to his tailoring business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will run a clothes manufacturing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es: Mireya invirtió su anterior credikiva en productos para tocador, como perfumes, ropa, bisutería productos de belleza y también compró medicina natural. Todos estos artículos los vendió, rotando rápidamente su mercancía y aumentando ligeramente su capital de trabajo. Con su nuevo kiva, al cual está aplicando,  comprará ropa y productos de belleza en mayor volumen, así mismo comprará un plan de minutos a celulares, para continuar aprovechando que tiene una buena clientela, a la que brindándole lo que necesita, genera nuevamente el incremento de sus utilidades en el negocio. Su mensaje a los financiadoras de Kiva es el siguiente: “Bendiciones para todo el grupo Kiva y que sigan apoyando a nuestros hermanos colombianos para cumplir los sueños de toda una familia. “
texts.en:
Mireya used her previous loan with Kiva to buy items such as perfumes, clothing, jewelry, beauty products, and also to buy natural medicines. She sold all these items and had a rapid turnover, slightly increasing her working capital. 

With this new loan that she is seeking, Mireya will buy clothing and beauty products in greater volume. She will also buy a cell phone plan so that she can continue serving her customers well. She wants to have for sale everything they need and thus increasing the amount of money she earns. Her message to Kiva donors is as follows: “Blessings on the whole of the Kiva group, and may you continue helping our brothers and sisters in Colombia so they can reach their dreams.”

loans.use: to buy buy clothing and beauty products and also a cell phone plan

loans.name: Wait For Me Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the Wait For Me group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each member in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kadiatu is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is 28 years old. She is married with two children: one in primary school, and the other is not of a school-going age. Kadiatu sells dishes, palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), onions, salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. With the help of this loan, Kadiatu will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, onions, salt, pepper, dried fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Mr. S. B.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the staff of a reputable company based in Tonkolili, in northern Sierra Leone. These guys have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni City, to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, these gentlemen can pay school fees for their children, buy house-building materials, invest in the business, etc. And at the end of each month, they use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. Their company’s finance officer is directly responsible for making the repayment on their behalf.

S.B. is the leader of this group. Born in Magburaka Town, in northern Sierra Leone, S.B. is married to a teacher, and the couple has eight children, six of whom are attending primary, secondary, and tertiary institutions. S.B. has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, boards, nails, cement, etc., for the construction of a family dwelling.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron, corrugated zinc, boards, nails, cement, etc., for the construction of a family dwelling

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es socia del Bancomunal Buena Suerte, tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, y socia de FINCA Perú hace 3 años. Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales (vitaminas prolife) y tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal ya que en ellas comparte experiencias con sus amigas, se siente alegre y motivada. Agradece a la Institución por las facilidades de crédito  que le brindan por tanto ella cumple con los reglamentos establecidos en su Bancomunal. El nuevo préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos naturales y  abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en: Vilma is a member of the communal bank “Buena Suerte” (Good Luck). She is 56 years old, married and has 2 children. She has been with FINCA Peru for 3 years. She earns her living selling natural products (Prolife vitamins) and has a grocery store. She likes to go to communal bank meetings since in those meetings she shares experiences with her friends and she feels happy and motivated. She is grateful to the institution for the loan facilities it offers and for this reason she always abides by the rules established by the communal bank. She is asking for a loan to buy natural products and groceries for her shop.

loans.use: to buy natural products and groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria de 59 años de edad, soltera, de oficio comerciante, originaria de Granada, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 40 años, realizo estudios hasta la primaria. Inicio su actividad en un humilde tramo que alquilaba en el mercado,  luego por medio de ayuda le cedieron un local donde solo tenía que hacerse cargo de la limpieza y de remodelarlo el cual acepto, ella con el tiempo y esfuerzo propio  ha ido acondicionando el lugar para una mejor presentación que atraiga mas clientela, saca su negocio adelante por si sola con el deseo de mejorar cada día tanto en el servicio de comida como en la mejora del local.
Realiza el préstamo para comprar leña, carne, pollo, aceite, arroz, plátanos, toda la materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas, sus planes futuros es mantener siempre su negocio para satisfacción de su clientela pues se considera una persona muy responsable con sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 59, is single; she’s a merchant from Granada who has been selling food for 40 years.  She only attended elementary school.  She started her activity in a humble stretch of leased space in the market and later on by means of some help she was ceded a locale where all she had to do was clean and remodel it; she accepted it and in time and through her own efforts she’s been gradually equipping it so that it will be more attractive to customers.  She moves her business forward by herself hoping to improve her food service more each day like with the improvements to the locale.

She is taking out the loan to buy firewood, meat, chicken, oil, rice and bananas, all the raw materials she needs to prepare her dishes.  Her plan for the future is to stay in business to please her customers because she considers herself to be a person who is very responsible toward her customers.

loans.use: to buy firewood, meat, chicken, oil, rice and bananas.

loans.name: Anaclovia

texts.es:
Anaclovia, solicita un préstamo para aumentar la capacidad del negocio, pues de esta manera podrá atraer a más clientela, comprara ropa en variedad como blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, ya que tiene el plan de crecer en el comercio y a través de los préstamos está logrando su posición en el mercado.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue favorable, pues mejoro su nivel de inventario, ha tenido buenas ganancias y su único inconveniente han sido problemas de salud pero que se están superando.
texts.en:
Anaclovia is asking for a loan to increase her business’ capacity in order to be able to take care of more customers.  She will buy assorted clothes like blouses, skirts, pants and underwear because she plans to grow in the market and by means of the loans she’s securing her place in the market.

The previous loan had a favorable effect because she improved her inventory’s level; she’s had good profits and the only obstacle she’s faces has been some health issues but she’s overcoming them.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eugenia Magdalena

texts.es:
EUGENIA MAGDALENA tiene 40 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad , vive con el esposo y con el hijo en Guaranda  Provincia Bolívar.

EUGENIA MAGDALENA es una mujer que se gana la vida lavando ropa, además recibe penciones alimenticias. Solicita el crédito para realizarce una operación de los ojos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la salud. La operación se la realizarán en la ciudad de Riobamba. 

El sueño  es poder arreglar la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es tener una buena salud y comprarse una casa. En el tiempo libre sigue cursos de aprendisaje de belleza.
texts.en:
Eugenia Magdalena, 40, is married and has a 13 year old son.  She lives with her husband and son in Guaranda, Bolívar Province.  Eugenia Magdalena is a woman who earns her livelihood washing clothes and she also provides regular meals for people.  

She’s asking for the loan in order to have eye surgery.  With help from the loan her health will improve.  The operation will take place in the city of Riobamba.

Her dream is to fix up her house.  The challenges she faces are having good health and to buy a house.  In her free time she is taking beauty courses.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Marcia Janneth

texts.es:
MARCIA JANNETH tiene 20 años de edad es soletra no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Guaranda provincia de bolívar.

MARCIA JANNETH se dedica al comercio de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de animales cómo cerdos. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales para cruiarlos y poder venderlos.

Las compras lo hará en Guanujo. El sueño es poder casarse y tener hijos. El desafío al que se enfrenta es estudiar. En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Marcia Janneth is 20 years old, she is single, and she does not have children.  She lives with her parents in the Guaranda province of Bolivar.

Maria Janneth sells pigs.  She is seeking a loan so that she can buy animals, such as pigs.  She will purchase them in Guanujo.  

Her dream is to get married and have children.  Her current challenge is in studying.  In her free time she likes working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy animals, such as pigs.

loans.name: Musa's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the staff of a very reputable company in Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. This group of colleagues have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city, to apply for a loan. With the help of these loans, they will be able to do or invest in things that their salaries alone cannot let them do or invest in. For example, some will be able to buy pieces of household furniture or house building materials, pay school fees for their children, invest in agriculture or in business, etc. At the end of each month, their company’s financial officer will repay the loan on their behalf.

Musa is the leader of this team. The 42-year-old is a native of Port Loko. He is married to a businesswoman, and they have one child who is attending secondary school.  Musa has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials for the completion of a house he had begun. He will buy iron, corrugated zincs, board, paints, cements, etc.

loans.use: To buy iron, corrugated zincs, board, paints, cements, etc.

loans.name: Colletta

texts.en:
Colleta is a married woman. She has 2 children ranging from 5 years old to 15 years old. She describes herself as patient. 

Colleta operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a busy town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low bargaining power from the customers. She will use the loan of 10,000 KES to buy clothes. 

Colletta had previously taken a loan of 10,000 KES, of which she managed to pay back the entire amount. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a 25 year old single woman. She describes herself as an aggressive woman. 

Doreen was employed earlier as a househelp. She decided to start a grocery store where she has been selling  vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, kale, onions, etc. for 4 years. Her business is located along a busy road and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of vegetables. 

Doreen will use the loan of 15,000 KES loan to buy vegetables. This is her first loan. Her business goal is to run another grocery store in her nearby town  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future with the profits generated she will run a cereal retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto se dedica a alquilar lavadoras, ofrece el servicio de telecomunicaciones por minutos y vende mercancía variada; tres actividades con las que genera ingreso y apoya el ingreso de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 14 a 18 años. Su negocio inició una vez regresó de Venezuela, país fronterizo donde vivía y trajo consigo unos ahorros que le sirvieron como capital semilla, para emprender su propia aventura de negocios, que le ayudara al sustento de su hogar, debido a que no encontró oportunidades laborales. Él compró 6 lavadoras, un taxi de servicio público y dos celulares, en compañía de su hermano, con lo cual ha logrado el sostenimiento de su negocio y ha agregado aun otros servicio, el  de recargas a celulares, que es muy rentable, también ha  mejorado su infraestructura de negocio, con nuevas lavadoras, porque su clientela ha crecido. Su meta mas adelante, es posicionarse en el mercado comercial de la tecnología celular y quieren vender accesorios y aparatos más modernos; su mayor desafío es no tener suficiente capital de trabajo para hacer inversiones de manera inmediata, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara recargas para celulares, hará reparaciones técnicas a sus lavadoras, para que no se deterioren y con ellos fortalecerá de manera inmediata su negocio, haciéndolo cada vez mas exitoso.
texts.en:
Alberto leases washing machines and provides telecommunication services by the minute; he also sells general merchandise.  He generates income to support his family, composed of his wife and two children who are 14 and 18 years old, with these three businesses.  

He started his business when he returned from Venezuela, a bordering country where he used to live.  He brought some savings with him that served as seed capital to start his own business venture that will help him support his home because he didn’t find employment opportunities.

He bought six washing machines, a public service taxi and two mobile phones together with his brother with which he was able to sustain his business.  He’s added more services, mobile phone recharges, which is very profitable.  He’s also improved the business’ infrastructure with new washing machines because his clientele has grown.

His goal for later on is to position himself in the mobile phone technology commercial marketplace; they want to sell accessories and more modern equipment.  His greatest challenge is lacking sufficient working capital to make the investment immediately and this is why he’s calling on a Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo by means of which he will buy mobile phone recharges and repair his washing machines so that they will not wear away and with this he’ll strengthen his business making it more successful each time.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone recharges and to repair his washing machines.
